loans.name: Locadia

texts.es: La señora Locadia de 56 años de edad, casada, es originaria de Jinotega, actualmente vive en Estelí, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería, su nivel académico es hasta segundo grado de primaria. Ella inicio su negocio  con capital propio, anteriormente en Jinotega  también tenía el negocio de pulpería, luego se casa, se traslada con su esposo a vivir a Estelí, donde decide seguir con  el mismo negocio en su casa de habitación, en su pulpería  recibe el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes. Locadia quiere diversificarse mas en productos para su pulpería pues su expectativa es mantener su negocio activo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar pan, leche, huevo, azúcar, jabón, arroz, etc. Toda la mercadería necesaria para surtir su pulpería, el cual estima será de ayuda pues podrá invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos mas solicitados por los clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio para mayor atracción de clientes con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos, su meta próxima es hacerle mejora a su casa con los ingresos que le genere el negocio para tener mejores condiciones de vida y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Locadia, 56, is originally from Jinotega but currently lives in Estelí.  She is married, has a second grade education and runs a grocery store that she started with her own capital.  In Jinotega she also ran a grocery store before she married and moved to Estelí, where she opened business in her home.  Her husband helps her attend to customers.

Locadia wants to diversify the products she carries in the grocery store in order to keep business going and to satisfy customer demand.  She is requesting a loan to buy bread, milk, sugar, soap, rice, etc., which are the goods most often requested by customers.  Her future plans include expanding the store to attract more customers in order to increase her income.  Her next goal is to renovate her house with profits from the business in order to have a better lifestyle and be able to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy bread, milk, eggs, sugar, soap,rice, etc.

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es: Juana Dolores de 38 años de edad de la localidad de leon, con cuatro años de experiencia, tiene por actividad economica un pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, activida que la inicio para tener un medio de cómo ayudar en los gastos del hogar, Juana dolores ya tiene experiencia con los creditos ya  ha realizados varios los cuales le han ayudado para poder sutir su pequeño negocio gracias al apoyo que fundacion leon  2000  y el programa kiva le brindan a pequeños comerciantes, del fiananciamiento comprara productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, tiste, leche, pan, huevos, cremas, mantequillas, cebadas, frescos naturales, entre otros
texts.en: Juana Dolores, 38, is from Leon.  For four years she has been running a grocery store she set up in her home to earn extra income to cover household expenses.  Juana Dolores has experience with previous loans that she has used to stock her small business.  Thanks to the support given by  the Fundación Leon 2000 and Kiva to small business owners, she will use this loan to buy daily home consumption items such as rice, beans, sugar, "tiste" (corn/cocoa drink), milk, bread, eggs, cream, butter, barley, natural beverages, etc.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, "tiste" (corn/cocoa drink), milk, bread, eggs, cream, butter, barley, natural beverages, etc.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr Andres esta casado y con tres hijos,cursando primaria y secundaria, el trabaja para una comercializadora de agua su esposa  se dedica al hogar,el señor andres quiere pagar gastos escolares,colegiaturas y matariales de uso escolar asegurarles la eduacion y su futuro a sus hijos y asi mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Andres is married and has three children in primary and secondary school.  He works for a water company and his wife is a homemaker.  Andres wants to pay school costs and registration fees and buy school supplies in order to give his children a good education and improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay school costs and registration fees.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town in the southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 9 years and 18 years. Her four children are currently attending school.

Fatmata runs a general shop where she sells rubber bowls, body cream, baby oil, and powder. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business 6 days per week and 10 hours per day. Her business is the only source of income she has. She began her business because she needs to generate income to support her family.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more rubber bowls, body cream, baby oil, and powder. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and build a house. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber bowls, body cream, baby oil, and powder.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 27 years old and single with 1 child, age 7 years. She runs a hawker business in Bo town in the southern area of Sierra Leone. Her child is currently going to school.

She's been in this business for 8 years and sells baby food, rubber bowls, bags and hair. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to invest in the business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more cosmetic items like baby oil, body cream, human hair and jewelry. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her start up a savings account and educate her child. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic items like baby oil, body cream, human hair and jewelry.

loans.name: Dieu Merci A Group

texts.fr: Groupement solidaire d’hommes, ayant pour nom DIEU MERCI A tous  basés dans l’agriculture (la culture du mais), Mr AGOTO est nommé par les autres pour les diriger. C’est un jeune homme de 26ans qui est marié à une revendeuse et a en charge 05enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Il est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et ce montant l’aidera à s’approvisionner en outils de travail car il est jardinier/cultivateur. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 06ans et il est basé en RÉGION CENTRALE. 03 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de son activité. Avec les profits supplémentaires, il veut acheter une moto pour aller au champ, construire une maison et ouvrir une ferme agricole. Il veut aussi à l’avenir, assurer la santé, la scolarisation et l’autosuffisance alimentaire des enfants. Il est à  préciser que le responsable n’a pas pris de crédit pour l’avancement de son activité.
texts.en: The men's solidarity group, called Dieu Merci a Tous, is based in agriculture (cultivating corn).   Mr. Agoto has been named by the others to lead.  He is a young man of 26 who is married to a vendor and has five children in his care, three of whom attend school.  He is on his third loan with WAGES and this money will help him to buy tools for his work as a gardener/cultivator.  He has been doing this type of work for six years and is based in the Central region.  Three people help him in is work.  With his extra profits, he wants to buy a motorcycle  to go to the fields, to build a house, and to start an agricultural farm.   He also wants, for the future, to be able to assure the health, education, and nutritional stability of his children.  The leader has not taken the loan for the advancement of his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for their work.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Aminata from Moriba town southern area in Bo town. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. She began this business because she needs a permanent source of income.

Aminata runs a provision shop where she sells milk, sugar, tea leaves, phone cards, sardines and bread. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day and 6 days per week. She also earns income from her elder son. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital to operate the business.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more milk, sugar, tea leaves, phone cards, sardines and bread. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and start up a savings account. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar, tea leaves, phone cards, sardines and bread.

loans.name: Peguaho Group

texts.es:
El comite se llama Peguaho, debido a que asi se llama la compañia que viven ellas, el grupo tiene  21 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades, y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias.
Gumercinda es una de las miembros del grupo, es la presidenta y comenta que siempre motiva a sus amigas a que sigan luchando por sus metas y sus sueños y de esa forma salir adelante. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee is called Peguaho because that is the name of the community where they live.  The group is comprised of twenty-one women who invest their loans in their respective businesses and this is how they support their families.  

Gumercinda is one of the members, and she is president of the group.  She says that she always encourages her friends to continue striving for their goals and dreams so they can get ahead in life.  She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables so that she can continue working and offering good variety to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguya.  
.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Hawa from Moribatown southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child, age 3 years. In 2005, Hawa established her provision shop business. After she finished her secondary school education she got married and started up this business. She works at the business seven days per week, and she is living in the shop with her husband and child. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price inflation. 

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more eggs, cream, sweets, paste and biscuits. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her shop and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to build a house and expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more eggs, cream, sweets, paste and biscuits.

loans.name: Margrette

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Margrette from Moribatown southern area in Bo. She is widowed with 4 children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. Three of her children attend school. She began her business because after her husband died, she need a permanent source of income to support the family. 

Margrette runs a food stand business where she sells gari (ground and roasted cassava root) and sugar. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from small-scale farming. Margrette describes her major problem as lack of enough capital to run her business.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more local goods such cassava grain and bag sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business and try to see her children educated. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more local goods such a cassava grain and bag sugar.

loans.name: Gafa

texts.en: Gafa is a 20-year-old married woman with 1 child. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow and manure chemicals to start her plantation. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Gafa will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow and manure chemicals.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu is 46 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and baking soda and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Talaleu will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda, sugar and a frying pan.

loans.name: Vaitulu

texts.en: Vaitulu is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling keke saina in her community (Keke saina, or Chinese Cake, is a cookie with an onion-based paste filling). To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, garlic, onions, yeast and soy sauce. In the future, Vaitulu hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, garlic, onions, yeast and soy sauce.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is an artisan who crafts exquisite silver jewelry, often with gemstones such as Guatemalan jade. He would like to purchase a supply of fine silver so he can continue his craft.

Pedro has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"When I was 20, I began working in a silver workshop and my passion for making handcrafted jewelry was born. I specialize in engraving silver and have had my own workshop since 1980; it's a simple place, but I have all the tools and space I need to work. I am very grateful for this wonderful opportunity you are giving me and my artisan community in Guatemala."

"Many thanks to all my friends who have shown their trust by giving me this financial help. My plan is to purchase additional silver so I can continue working. May God bless all of you and your families."

Use the link below to view Pedro's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8193

loans.use: to purchase a supply of fine silver so he can continue his craft.

loans.name: Vap4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VAP4 est composé de quatorze personnes qui  habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement, sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé afin d’élever le niveau de leur Le activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Augustin. Le couple a huit enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses  enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis dix sept ans la vente de la nourriture dans un quartier du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Jeanne vend des pâtés. Ces activités lui permettent de contribuer aux besoins de sa famille. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans son quartier et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VAP4 un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The VAP4 group consists of fourteen people who all live in the same neighbourhood. This is the first time that the group is requesting financial support from the micro-finance institution ALIDé in order to improve the level of their businesses. The leader of the group is called Jeanne. She is raising her hand in the photo. She is 48 years old and married to Augustin. The couple has eight children who are all educated, two of whom are in their care. Jeanne lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses. To this end, Jeanne has been selling food in a neighbourhood in Benin for 17 years. In addition to this activity, Jeanne also sells pasta. These business activities enable her to cater to her family's needs. She gets her supplies from her neighbourhood and from a market in Benin. In order to ensure customer satisfaction and increase her revenue and income, she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the VAP4 group.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
Edmundo is an artisan who specializes in the traditional Peruvian art of reverse painted glass. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as high quality wood and glass to expand production of his mirrors and jewelry boxes.

Edmundo has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story in his words.

"I inherited my interest in art from my mother, a weaver," he says. "As an adolescent, I enjoyed painting and liked to create cartoons as a form of social protest, when terrorists threatened our land. Now I specialize in painted glass and crackled finishes, a technique that is both traditional and modern. My themes include pre-Hispanic, colonial and ethnic as a tribute to the beauty and culture of the Andean world and its wildlife."

"I admit to being an admirer of Peruvian colonial art, and I love being able to express my passion through a traditional art form such as reverse painted glass," he says. "It allows me to capture the colors, shapes, and silver and golden glimmer that is characteristic of this art form. The fact that my products may be arriving at people's homes around the world is very exciting, and all I need to do is to continue crafting items inspired by something I already love to do – what a blessing! I would like to thank you for the opportunity that this interest-free micro-loan provides."

Use the link below to view Edmundo's reverse painted mirrors and jewelry boxes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4249

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as high quality wood and glass to expand production of his mirrors and jewelry boxes.

loans.name: Muavae

texts.en:
Muavae is a 22-year-old, single woman with no children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Muavae has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, fertilizers and crops for her farming business. 

Muavae has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Muavae hopes to expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, knives, fertilizers and crops for her farming business.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience in this business. 

Monika needs a loan to buy her husband some fishing gear. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Monika has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear such as spears, nets, goggles and a canoe.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafeai is 73 years old and married. She has seven children. 

Faafeai has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Faafeai needs a loan to buy crops, chemicals and fertilizers for her farming business.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Faafeai will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy crops, chemicals and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 29-year-old, single woman with no children. 

She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Matalena has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, knives, crops and chemicals for her farming business.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Matalena will invest her profits into expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, knives, crops and chemicals for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 03 bags of rice, 01 bag of flour and 05 cans of oil.

loans.name: Massavoh Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MASSAVOH est composé de seize personnes qui  habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe, sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé afin d’élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de  Juliette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliette a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris la couture. Juliette est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Juliette mène comme activité depuis huit ans la couture dans son atelier au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Juliette vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc) dans son atelier. Ces activités lui permettent  de contribuer aux besoins de sa famille. Juliette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Juliette sollicite ensemble avec  les autres membres du groupe MASSAVOH un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MASSAVOH group consists of sixteen people who all live in the same neighbourhood. This is the second time that the group is requesting financial support from the micro-finance institution ALIDé in order to improve the level of their businesses. The leader of the group is called Juliette. She is raising her hand in the photo. Juliette left primary school and trained as a seamstress. Juliette is 34 years old and married to a joiner named Gilbert. The couple has four children who are all in school and in their care. Juliette lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses. To this end, Juliette has been working as a seamstress in her workshop in Benin for eight years. In addition to this activity, Juliette sells various food products (corn, cassava flour, etc) from her workshop. These business activities enable her to cater to her family's needs. Juliette gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to ensure customer satisfaction and increase her revenue and income, Juliette is requesting her second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the MASSAVOH group. The first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is an artisan who would like to stock up on colorful cotton for his weavings and also hardware and accessories for his handbags.

Andres has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"When I was eight years old, my father thought it was time for me to learn to weave on a floor loom, just like he did. My products are associated with the history of Guatemala; for example, our ancestors used to place tortillas in a square holder woven by women on a backstrap loom. Now, that same tortilla holder is used as a placemat or napkin. I have taught the art of weaving to more than 80 people, and now I dedicate most of my time to designing new colors with natural dyes, innovating weaving techniques, and supervising apprentices."

"I'm very grateful to have this opportunity, as the loan will let me buy the materials I need to keep bringing my work to the weavers in my community. By having a stock of materials on hand, I am able to keep more weavers at work so they can earn money for their own families. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Andres' original accessories on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7431

loans.use: To stock up on colorful cotton for his weavings and also hardware and accessories for his handbags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and 15 meters of fabric.

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en:
Faalua is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. She wants to start a small business making and selling printed materials in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan to buy the needed materials. 

In the future, Faalua hopes to expand her business to earn more income. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase paints, stencils, and other materials.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 66 years old, married, and has nine children. She owns and operates a sewing business. She has many years of experience in this line of work. 

Susana is requesting a loan to buy needed materials. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, threads, needles, zippers, and materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 32 year old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, she makes and sells pancakes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy ingredients needed in her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Susana has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, baking soda, and coloring.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is a 34 years old, married, and has five children. To earn a living, she makes and sells pork buns in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Lesina is requesting a loan to buy ingredients needed in her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Lesina has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, flour, and baking soda.

loans.name: Polini

texts.en:
Polini is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients needed in her business. 

In the future, Polini hopes to improve her business so she can earn good income. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, baking soda, and coloring.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, además de alegre y sociable. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijos. Ahora vive sólo con uno de ellos, Cristian de 23 años. La casa donde viven es alquilada.

Ella se dedica a la costura y confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene un pequeño taller que implementó en su vivienda donde instaló sus máquinas de coser. Este oficio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comenzar con su negocio, comprando una pequeña máquina y haciendo confesiones a sus vecinas y amigas, logró hacerse conocida y ganar más clientes, fue creciendo y comprando más máquinas que facilitaban su trabajo, mejorando los acabados. Realiza esta actividad hace más de 16 años, contando con la ayuda de una sobrina a quien paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite desempeñarse en un oficio de su agrado, pues se siente a gusto elaborando nuevos diseños, así como atendiendo a sus clientes. Tiene planes de ampliar el espacio de su negocio y en el futuro  abrir una boutique en ese mismo lugar.

Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida porque así podrá avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse cómoda con el grupo de su banco comunal, ya que los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para confesión de ropa; como telas, hilos, botones y otros. También adquirirá una nueva máquina de coser que estaría valorizada en 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 47 years old. She is a hard-working and very enterprising woman, in addition to being cheerful and sociable. She is separated from the father of her two children. She currently lives with just one of them, Cristian, age 23. The house where they live is rented.

She works providing tailoring services and making clothing. She has a small workshop which she set up in her home, where she installed her sewing machines. She learned this profession at a vocational education center, and she later started her business, buying a small machine and making garments for her friends and neighbors. She was able to make herself known and gain more customers, expanding her business and buying more machines to facilitate her work, thus improving her results. She has done this work for more than 16 years, with the help of a niece whom she pays by the week for her work. What she likes about her work is that it lets her use her talents in a profession she enjoys, since she likes coming up with new designs, and she also likes serving her customers. She has plans to expand the space dedicated to her business, and in the future to open a boutique in this same place. 

This is loan number 5 for her with the MFP institution, and she feels grateful because in this way she will be able to move ahead with her business. She also feels comfortable with the members of her communal bank, since she considers them responsible people with a sense of solidarity. 

With the amount she is requesting, 1500 Peruvian new soles, she will invest in buying supplies to make clothing, such as fabrics, thread, buttons and other items. She will also acquire a new sewing machine, valued at 600 new soles.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies and a new sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is 38 years old, married, and has six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living, which she has been doing for many years. 

Matauaina is requesting a loan to buy materials needed for her farm. With her profits, she hopes to expand her business to earn more income for her family.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, knives, fertilizers, and crops.

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FINANGNON est composé de dix neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Addiffondé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Addiffondé est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Addiffondé n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Addiffondé est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Rémi. Addiffondé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Addiffondé exerce divers métiers de transformations à savoir : la transformation des noix de palme en huile de palme et la transformation du manioc en farine de manioc. Addiffondé vend ses produits dans certaines régions du Bénin. Addiffondé s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Addiffondé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FINANGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The FINANGNON group is composed of 19 women who live in the same district.  The representative of the group, named Addiffondé is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Addiffondé is 42 years old and lives in Bénin.  Addiffondé did not attend school.  She is married to a farmer named Rém and  lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meets the various needs of the family.   In order to meet different family responsibilities, Addiffondé works in different types of food processing such as turning palm nuts into palm oil and manioc into manioc flour.  Addiffondé sells her products in certain regions of Bénin.  She gets her supplies in the region.  In hopes of meeting the demands of her customers and to increase her turnover and her income, Addiffondé is requesting, along with the other members of the FINANGNON group, a third loan through ALIDé.  The previous two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy manioc and palm nuts.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Aty” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron con las ganas de ser mejores microempresarias y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría de animales y también a su venta, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos y demás, y es con este trabajo que ayudan a sus familias y les dan todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Evangelista, una de las miembros, solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, con lo cual podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales y de esa forma tener una buena cría.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Aty” committee is formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are women who are heads of the household that got together with the disire of being better small business owners, and in this way help their families. 

All of the women make a living raising and selling animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks and others.It is with this work that they help their families and give them all they need for a life without deprivation. 

Evangelista is one of the members. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of animal feed, with which she will continue feeding her animals. In this way, she will raise her animals well.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” tiene 10 integrantes, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Luisa, una de las miembros del grupo se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sándwich, y otros. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que ella tiene muy buena sazón y eso le ayuda mucho.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, hortalizas, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende y también cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Maria Auxiliadora" committee has ten members. They are all female friends and neighbors in the city of Santaní. Luisa, one of the member of the group, makes a living selling foods of all types, including empanadas, sandwiches and others. She says that she has a good clientele because she has good flavor in her food and this helps her a lot. 

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and others. This will allow her to continue making the foods that she sells and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy  meat, condiments, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 34  years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children.  Letty  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. 

She had this business for 5  years.  She requested a loan for  PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Letty has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business so that she can provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Lani

texts.en:
Maria Lani is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children.  Maria Lani is selling pillows and curtains in her local community. 

She has had this business for 8 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of pillows and curtains to resell.  Maria Lani is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Lani hopes to improve her business in order to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy stocks of pillow and curtain to resell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Es soltera y no tiene hijos todavía. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus dos hermanos, a quienes quiere mucho.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y accesorios. Toda su mercadería la trae desde la ciudad capital, realizando viajes periódicos para ello. Sus clientes, generalmente, son sus vecinos y amistades, y también sus colegas de su trabajo, pues es docente en un centro educativo de su localidad. Realiza este negocio hace más de un año y le gusta porque es un oficio propio e independiente.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además, se compromete una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa de diversos modelos, al por mayor. También suplirá los gastos de viaje a la capital para la compra de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Jessica is 25 years old and is a very hard-working and motivated woman.  She is single and does not yet have children.  She lives with her parents and her siblings, who she loves very much.

She works selling clothing, shoes and accessories.  She gets all of her merchandise from the capital city, making periodic trips for this reason.  Her customers, generally, are her neighbors and friends, and also her colleagues from work, since she is a teacher in an educational center in her town.  She has been working in this business for more than a year and she likes it because it is her own work and independent.

This is her second loan through the institution MFP, and thus she hopes to continue with her goals.  Also, she promises once again to meet all of the payment deadlines and amounts, like with the previous credit.

With the requested loan, of 3000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will invest in the purchase of more clothing of diverse styles, bought in bulk.  The loan will also help to cover the costs of travel to the capital to purchase her merchandise.

loans.use: to pay for travel and for the purchase of merchandise in the capital city.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista, además de alegre y extrovertida. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Ahora vive sólo con ellos; Kensi de 25 años y Tedsu de 18  años. Su casa es propia, la construyó en el terreno que le heredó su padre.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida al paso, como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollo frito, etc. Todo lo prepara durante el día, luego instala su puesto en el frontis de su casa, por la noche empiezan a llegar sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y algunos transeúntes.   Viene realizando esta actividad hace más de 20 años y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda  de su hermana en la preparación y en la atención a los clientes, dándole un pago diario, de esa manera también la apoya con un ingreso económico. Le gusta su actividad por contar con un ingreso económico para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, además le gusta cocinar, labor que aprendió gracias a su madre, quien le enseñó desde muy joven. El problema es el cansancio físico que le ocasiona las largas jornadas, pues se queda hasta muy tarde en la noche para acabar de vender todo lo que prepara, pero es consciente que es su fuente de ingreso económico y desea continuar.  

Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero, desea seguir contando con más créditos, por eso dice que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Además, está a gusto con el grupo de su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de madera para el arreglo de su puesto de venta, además de mesas y sillas. También renovará sus utensilios de cocina (platos, cucharas, tenedores, vasos, entre otros).
texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and is a very hard working and optimistic woman. She is also happy and extroverted. She is separated from the father of her children. She now lives alone with them, Kensi is 25 years old and Tedsu is 18 years old. She has her own house, which she built on the land that she inherited from her father. 

She makes a living preparing and selling food on the go like noodles, rice "chaufa", fried chicken, etc. She prepares everything during the day and then is posted in the front of her house. During the evenings her customers begin to arrive that are for the most part her neighbors and people passing by. She has been doing this work for more than 20 years and she currently counts on her sister for help in preparing food and attending to the customers. She gives her a daily pay. In this way she supports her with an income. She likes her work because she relies on the income to be able to cover the household expenses. In addition, she likes to cool, a skill that she learned thanks to her mother, who taught her when she way very young. The problem is the physical exhaustion that comes to her on long days since she remains open until very late in the night to sell everything she that prepared. She is conscious that it is her source of income and wishes to continue.

This is the fourth loan she has with the MFP institution and she feels thankful for the financial support. She hopes to continue counting on more loans. Because of this she says that she will be punctual with the payment of her dues, as in the previous loans. In addiition, she likes the group that makes up her communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people.

With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of wood to fix up her locale. She also needs tables and chairs. She will also replace her cooking utensils (plates, spoons, forks, glasses, and others).

loans.use: to fix up her locale with tables and chairs and get new cooking utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas trabaja con la fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2010,  se encuentran  en el 7º ciclo gracias a su trabajo en conjunto y a su apoyo constante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María, ella tiene una confitería en su barrio y comenta que tiene muy buena venta ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos son sus clientes y eso le da muy buena ganancia. Cuenta la Sra. María  que solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos  en general para la elaboración de sus productos,  como ser harina, dulces, azúcar, manteca y demás.
Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas works with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2010. They are in their seventh loan cycle thanks to their work together and constant support. 

One of the members of the group is María. She has a candy shop in her neighborhood and she comments that she has good sales because the majority of her neighbors are her customers and this gives her very good earnings. María says that she is requesting the loan to buy general ingredients to make her products, including flour, sweets, sugar, butter and more. 

She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving. This will be of much help to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sweets, sugar, butter and more.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 43 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, como también alegre y sociable. Su pareja es Rodolfo, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 24 y 13 años. 
Su actividad es la venta de ropa y zapatos que trae a pedido desde la ciudad capital, para luego venderlos de forma personal a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al contado como también a crédito de 15 días. Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 8 años y lo que más le gusta es que le permite socializar con las personas, brindarles un buen servicio en la atención, así como contar con un ingreso económico, ya que con el sueldo de su pareja no les alcazaba, teniendo muchas necesidades. Por ello decidió a trabajar en este negocio y viendo los buenos resultados tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer el volumen de su stock de mercadería.

Este es el préstamo número 4 que tiene con la institución MFP. Además de sentirse muy bien con su banco comunal, pues lo considera ser un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos y marcas, en mayor cantidad, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, de esa manera busca anticiparse a la campaña de las fiestas patrias.
texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and is a very motivated and hard-working woman.  She is also very happy and sociable.  Her partner is Rodolfo, with whom she has two children ages 24 and 13.  

Her activity is the selling of clothes and shoes that she brings by request from the capital city, in order to then sell them personally to her neighbors and family.  Many times she sells them for cash, but she also offers a credit of 15 days.  She has worked in this activity for more than 8 years and what she likes the most is that it permits her to socialize with people, bringing them a good service with customer attention, and also being able to count on economic income, since the income from her partner is not sufficient and they have many needs.  For that reason she decided to work in this business and seeing the good results she has plans to continue and to make the volume of her merchandise and stock grow.

This is the fourth loan that she has taken with the institution MFP.  In addition, she feels very good about her communal bank, since she considers it a very united and supportive group.

With the requested loan, of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will invest in the purchase of clothing of diverse styles and brands, in bulk, looking for low prices by volume for her purchases.  In this way she looks forward to celebrating the upcoming season of patriotic festivals.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vaavaai

texts.en:
Vaavaai is a 28 year old married woman with 2 children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living.  She has been doing this for many years. 

Vaavaai has requested a loan to buy materials needed for her plantation.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits,Vaavaai hopes to expand her business and keep on doing it for family income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals and crops.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. Lorena makes and sells home made coffee.  She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made coffee.  Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making home made coffee.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is 49 years old and single with no children.  She runs a small business selling vegetables and daily products in her community and has been doing this for many years.  

Sale has requested a loan to buy additional items to sell in the business.  She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Sale will use it to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, flour, oil, frying pan and rice.

loans.name: L’Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe L’ESPOIR est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun est âgée de 33 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun a peu fréquenté l’école. Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun vit seule avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis quatre ans, Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun exerce comme activité, la vente des jus de citron, des yaourts et des jus de bissapes. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe L’ESPOIR, un premier crédit auprès de  ALIDé.
texts.en:
L’ESPOIR Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Placidia Épiphanie Akodhêhoun is 33 years old and doesn't live with her husband anymore. She's the mother of two school-attending children whom she has to support. She herself didn't attend school much. She lives alone with her children, and ensure with her husband that the various household expenses get covered.

For four years, she's been selling lemon juice, yoghourts, and hibiscus juice. This business enables her to provide for herself and her children without much difficulty.  She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

Eager to better answer customers' needs, she would like to increase her stock of products, and bolster her business. In order to do this, she's seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and lemons

loans.name: Ana Hilma

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, comprandose más variedad de ropa nueva para diferentes edades en mujeres, caballeros y niños, por ejemplo ropa interior, falsas, camisas, blusas, que son lo más demandado por sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un mejor crecimiento del inventario esto también le permite ofrecer su clientela mayor variedad, hasta el momento considera que sus condiciones familiares están cambiando todo gracias  al buen manejo de los préstamos y el progreso en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in her business. She will buy a wider variety of new clothes for women, men, and children of various ages such as undergarments, skirts, shirts, and blouses. These items have the greatest demand among her customers.

With her previous loan, Ana was able to increase her inventory and also provide her customers with greater variety. At this moment, she believes her family’s conditions have changed thanks to her ability to manage her loans well and to make progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, skirts, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Ama Chuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMA CHUMA” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marleny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa interior, venta de juguetes, costura de edredones, venta de ropa para niños.

La señora Marleny, indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por la recomendación de su abuela, desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, ya que traían fardos de ropa americana del departamento de Oruro.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de ropa) mismo que comprará de las grandes ferias y posteriormente los comercializará en las comunidades del municipio de Caranavi. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Ama Chuma" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. It is made up of seven members and lead by a board of directors in which Marleny is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forward are varied. Among them we have cosmetics sales, salchipapa sales-a hot dog dish with fried potatoes, undergarment sales, toy sales, quilt sewing and sale of children's clothing.

Marleny indicates that is the first time that Pro Mujer is working with them, entering by an invitation of a promoter that went to her house. Currently she has a business selling clothing. She says that she began this business by the recommendation of her grandmother, many years ago because she used to bring bundles of American clothing from Oruro department. 

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital (to buy clothing), which she will buy in the large markets and then sell in communities of the Caranavi municipality. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as possible. She is in a civil union partnership and has six children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health sector.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES EN ACCIÓN” se encuentra en el Sexto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 15 integrantes y todas ellas realizan actividades productivas y gracias a ellas ayudan a sus familias.
Fani, es la presidenta de este grupo, es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas aganas de salir adelante, ya que tiene un espíritu emprendedor, y por sobre todo muchas ganas de salir adelante. Cuenta que tiene una mercería bien surtida, donde tiene artículos de bazar, calzados, prendas, y demás. Gracias a su buena variedad tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas y calzados, para poder surtir su negocio y seguir dando la variedad a su clientela
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Acción comunal bank is in its sixth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedores (Enterprising Woman) program at the Fundación Paraguaya. There are 15 members and they all work in productive activities that allow them to help their families.

Fani is the president of this group. She is a very hard-working woman and wants to move forward since she has an enterprising spirit. She has a well-stocked notions store, in which she has household products, shoes, clothes, and other products. Thanks to this large variety, she has a good customer base who always buys from her.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes and shoes so she can stock up her business and continue to provide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en: Mesepa is 54 years old and married and has 8 children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy fishing gear for improving her business. In the future, Mesepa hopes to improve her business to get a good income. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear such as spears, nets, goggles and a canoe.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. Erlinda  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, for which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Erlinda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business in order to fund the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lipena

texts.en: Lipena is 37 years old and married. She has 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice-cake & pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients and materials needed for developing her business. In the future, Lipena hopes to expand her business to get a good income. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, flour, oil and sunfruits.

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Leliosa sells snacks in her local community. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more snacks, like banana and juices, to re sell.

Leliosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Leliosa hopes to improve her business in order to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to re sell.

loans.name: Lorrylyn

texts.en:
Lorrylyn is from Montol, Ozamis City. She is 36 years old. Lorrylyn is married, having 6 children. 

To make a living, Lorrylyn owns & operates a retail business. She has been engaged in business for 15 years and earns 4,700 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Lorrylyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is married and has 3 children. Justina is 57 years old and lives in Patawag, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Justina owns a general store to earn her living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Justina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Justina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Doris Violeta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Doris, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se dedica a la artesanía, principalmente  a la elaboración de tejidos a base de fibra de alpaca para el mercado turístico, Doris invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar material como lana de alpaca, que le permita seguir produciendo sus tejidos.
Doris está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle seguir con su comercio y por apoyarla con su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is Sra. Doris. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) which is in the city of Cusco, Peru. Doris is in the handicraft trade, primarily the manufacture of knitted items made from alpaca fibers to be sold at the tourist market. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of materials, such as alpaca wool, so that she can continue producing these knitted items.

Doris is extremely grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue in her business and for supporting her with her family. She is appreciative of the loan and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy craft materials, such as alpaca wool.

loans.name: Luz Maribel

texts.es: Luz de 29 años de edad, casada, con 3 hijos,  ella vive con su familia en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, cortes. Luz es ama de casa, pero hace 3 años ella estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos etc. Al cual le dedica todo el día, ella tiene la ventaja de atender a su familia y al mismo tiempo su negocio. Ella inicio con fondos propios y con la ayuda de Odef incremento el inventario, y actualmente solicita un préstamo de L.15, 000.00 para invertir en compra de granos básico, refrescos, lácteos, y otros productos de la canasta básica. Así poder ofrecer a los clientes variedad de producto y sus ventas pueda crecer más y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

Luz is a homemaker, but she also established her own business three years ago. She has a grocery store where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products, and other items. Luz works every day and is able to take advantage of being able to look after her family while managing a business at the same time. She started out using her own funds, but with the help from ODEF, she was able to increase her inventory.

At the moment, Luz is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products, and other basic household items. This will enable her to offer a variety of products to her customers. As a result, her sales will grow even more and her family’s quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products, and other basic household items.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres capaces y muy trabajadoras que desean salir adelante.
Matilde es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que siempre trata de ayudar a sus compañeras, las motiva y les insta a seguir con sus metas. Matilde se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corrales, como ser gallinas y cerdos, con lo que ayuda a sus familiares quienes dependen de ella.
Matilde pide el préstamo para la compra de balanceados y también para la compra de pollitos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante por medio de su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en: Las Emprendedoras is a group formed in the city of Santaní.  It is made up of 12 women, all of them capable and very hardworking who desire to be successful.  Matilde is the president of the group, and she says that she always tries to help her members, motivating them and pushing them to continue with their goals.  Matilde works raising and selling penned animals like chickens and pigs, which allows her to help her family members who depend on her.  Matilde is asking for a loan to purchase balanced feed and also chicks, with which she will be able to continue working and getting ahead by means of her own effort.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Gina has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, for which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for  8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Gina  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business in order to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of eggs, rice and mineral water.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is from Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Fe is a widow and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business making & selling snack foods. Fe been in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Fe joined GDMPC. Fe is requesting a loan of 8,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is a 62-year-old mother of 7 kids, living in the rural area of Sangke district, Battambang Province. To make a living, she sells Vietnamese crepes and she also runs a small tailor shop. She can save about 12,000 KHR per day from both of her businesses. 

Nat has joined VisionFund for 6 loan cycles already and has completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to upgrade her standard of living. Now she forms a group consisting of three members, requesting new loans of 1,400,000 KHR each. She, the group leader, will use her portion to buy additional fabric for her tailor shop and more ingredients for making the pancakes, such as rice powder, sugar... etc. She hopes to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric for her tailor shop and more ingredients for making the pancakes.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Cristina has a store from which she sells chorizo and eggs. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of eggs and chorizo to re sell.

Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggs and chorizo to re sell.

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po is 56 years old, a resident living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. Po is married and has a married child and two school-aged children. Being a responsible father and head of the family, Po works very hard to raise his children and to provide them with basic necessities. Despite his hardships, Po wants to lift his family out of poverty and ensure a betting living standard. 

Recently, Po has been in the business of raising pigs and piglets in his yard and cultivating rice crops amongst the two seasons of the year. In addition, his wife helps him earn the household income by providing tailoring and sewing services to people in their community. 

Po is requesting financial support, amounting to USD 1,500, in order to enable him to buy an additional plot of farm land to enhance his business. Also, he will use a portion of the loan to purchase feeds for his pigs. He realizes that this loan will be a great help in improving his family-owned businesses.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farm land and to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comite Divino Niño Jesus esta ubicado en la ciudad de Chaco, estan en el cuarto ciclo, ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos que siempre se esfuerzan por sus familias para que salgan adelante. La Sra Estela, una de las miembros, se dedica a la cria y venta de chanchos, y con el credito que solicita desea poder comprar lechones para la cría y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora que desea poder salir adelante y de esa forma ser una gran microempresaria.
texts.en: The Committee "Divino Niño Jesus" is located in the city of Chaco, Paraguay.  The group is in its fourth loan cycle, and it is comprised of women of scarce means who always work to help their families get ahead.  Mrs. Estela, one of the group members, works raising and selling pigs, and with the loan that she is requesting she hopes to be able to purchase piglets to raise and in that way continue helping her family.  She defines herself as a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead and in this way be a great micro-business owner.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: 25 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JUNIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en sonbreritos, tejido de mantas de lana, venta de papa y chuño, hilado de lana de vicuña, tejido a máquina de polainas, sueter’s y busos, venta de salchipapa.

La señora Valeria, indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejedora de mantas, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por la de su cuñada desde hace tres años, la que le enseñó esta técnica de tejido, desde esa fecha ella lo trabaja diariamente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de lana) mismo que comprará de los almacenes de comercio y posteriormente los comercializará en ferias tradicionales de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "25th of June" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. It is made up of seven members and lead by a board of directors in which Valeria is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forward are several. Among them we have artisans of hats, wool blanket weaving, sales of potatoes and "chuño"--a type of freeze-dried potato, vicuña wool spinning, weaving leg warmers, sweaters and pants with a machine, and salchipapa sales--a hot dog dish with fried potatoes. 

Valeria indicates that this is the first time with Pro Mujer, entering by invitation from a promoter that went to her house. Currently she has a business weaving blankets. She says that she began this business because of her mother-in-law, three years ago. She taught her the skill of weaving, and since this time she works daily. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to buy wool) which she will buy from the commercial stores and then sells in traditional markets in El Alto. This manner of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as possible. She is married and has four children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health sector.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Moeurt's Group

texts.en:
Moeurt's group consist of three, all are female. Moeurt, the group leader, is 47 years old and also a mother of six children. Currently, there is only one daughter under her responsibility. To feed the family, she and her husband have been growing the paddy rice for 15 years. Additionally, her husband works for others for pay to make more income. 

For Moeurt, drought is the main obstacle, which affects her crop yield. This is the fifth loan cycle for Moeurt, as well as another member, while the third member has been with VisionFund for two times only. The loans have helped her to grow her paddy rice timely and to manage the family's cash flow. After the loans are paid, she is seeking for a new loan of 500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to pay for the costs of plowing and harvesting. She hopes to earn more income so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to pay for the costs of plowing and harvesting.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 39  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Teresa  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. Aside from this, she also sells viand and DVD tapes. She had this business for 6 years. 

Teresa has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business to benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: The Moung Russey district of Battambang Province is where Da lives, along with her group member. She is 30 years old. She has one dependent daughter, who is a minor and still in school. To support her household, she has been working as a farmer on a two hectare area of farmland and buying chickens to sell. This is the primary source of income for her family. Her husband works in order to help feed their family. She has been in these businesses for 10 years and is able to earn about 15,000 KHR. Da has taken out 2 previous loans from VisionFund and has managed to pay back the loans with success. The loans have helped her to gradually overcome her family's hardship. She is now applying for a new loan of 500,000 KHR with her group member, who is seeking a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan's portion to buy fertilizers for her rice farm and purchase more chickens to sell. She hopes that her current businesses will significantly improve so that she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice farm and purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Marrieta owns and operates a banana plantation, which she has been doing for five years. Marrieta earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Marrieta joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan for 10,800 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 29, lives in Cavite, Philippines with her husband and children. She earns a living by working hard at running a variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. Her products include shampoo, cooking oil, and food items. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day.

To continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to boost her business by buying more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell to her customers. 

Maricel hopes to be able to expand her business and give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 58 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the Philippines. Jesus makes sports, school, and office uniforms, which he has been doing for eight years. 

Jesus is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy more textiles for his uniforms.  He has been a member of HSPFI for since 2012.  In the future, Jesus hopes to improve his business so that he can pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for sports, school, and office uniforms.

loans.name: Jowelyn

texts.en:
Jowelyn previously borrowed 12,000 PHP, which she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Jowelyn is requesting another loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better her profitability. Her profits helps her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. 

Jowelyn hopes to be able to expand her business soon so that she is able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products wholesale (rice, beverages, oil, etc)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: La Sra. Ana tiene 49 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 15 años, ella tiene su bazar librería que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi, la Sra. Ana es cliente antigua préstamo es el 7 que ha tomado de emprender, la Sra. Ana es una persona muy amable con sus clientes ya que visitamos su negocio en varias oportunidades, la Sra. María va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería, cuadernos y hojas por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios comprando mas mercadería surtida y seguir creciendo en su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida para ofrecer variedad de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 49 years old and is married with 2 children aged 12 and 15. She has her own school supply store, located in the Pampahasi zone. Ana is an old client and this will be the 7th loan she has invested in her business. Ana is very kind to her customers and they visit her store at every opportunity.

Ana Maria will use the loan to buy merchandise, mainly notebooks and paper. Her reason for soliciting the loan is the necessity of re-stocking her business. Ana is confronting challenges to her business, mainly imbalances in the local economy. She will use the loan to purchase selected merchandise and continue growing the business. Her business aspirations are that her store could be larger, displaying a greater selection in order to offer a variety of merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and paper at wholesale to restock her business.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Foday from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married and has three children between the ages of four years and nine years. 

Foday runs a Clothing business; he sells shorts, waxed cotton, linen and traditional partner design dress. He has been running this business for 10 years.
