He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, seven days per week. His business is the only source of income he has. He says at present his major problem is insufficient capital to run his business. His wife is a petty trader and their income is not enough to support their three children and two relatives. 

Foday has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing material such as shorts, jeans, blouses and traditional partner design dress. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to become an international business man. He appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Foday from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more clothing such as shorts, jeans, blouses and traditional partner design dress.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is 29 years old, single and lives in the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the last six years, he has earned a living by planting and harvesting bananas. He joined GDMPC last year and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,500 to buy fertilizer. His goals for the future are to set money aside for emergencies and to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 60 años y es viuda. Tiene tres hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y viven aparte. Ella vive en compañía de su sobrino, quien la acompaña y apoya en todo momento.
Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió mirando y apoyando a su hermana en un pequeño taller. Cuando logró adquirir los conocimientos y experiencia necesaria pudo iniciarse  de manera independiente, gracias a un capital propio, fruto de los ahorros con su difunto esposo. Compró una máquina de coser, siendo esa su primera herramienta de trabajo, empezó cociendo y buscando clientes ella sola, hace más de 15 años atrás de eso. Le gusta su trabajo, debido al ingreso económico que le genera, además le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería, ropa de todo tipo. El problema son las largas horas que tiene que permanecer en una misma postura, pero eso no la desanima, continua trabajando y esforzándose para seguir progresando. Su deseo es poder comprar una máquina remalladora, la cual facilitaría mucho su trabajo.

Este es el préstamo número 21  que tiene con la institución MFP, pues conoció de estos préstamos hace muchos años atrás. Se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura, tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y otros, buscando la mejor calidad a menores precios.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 60 years old and a widow. She has three children, who are independent and live separately. She lives with her nephew, who accompanies her and supports her at all times.

Her activity is sewing, a trade that she learned by watching and supporting her sister in a small workshop. When she managed to acquire the knowledge and expertise necessary she was able to begin working independently, thanks to her own capital, the result of the savings she acquired with her late husband. She bought a sewing machine, being the primary tool of her work, and she started sewing and looking for customers all on her own, an activity she has been doing now for more than 15 years.  

She likes her job because of the income it generates, and she also likes to sew, make lingerie, and make clothing of all kinds. The problem is the long hours that she has to remain in the same position, but this does not discourage her.  She continues working and striving for further progress. She hopes to buy a serger machine, which would greatly facilitate her work.

This is the 21st loan that she has taken with the institution MFP, since she learned of these loans many years ago.  She is grateful for the financial support she has received and wishes to continue to have this support, so she agrees to comply with the payment of their fees, as with the previous loans.

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) she will invest in the purchase of sewing materials such as fabrics, threads and other items, looking for better quality at lower prices.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials (fabric, thread, elastic, etc.)

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 27 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Jocelyn buys and sells eggs in her local villages, which she has been doing for five years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy eggs to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business so that she can provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 51 years old and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For the last two years, he has supported his two children by growing corn. He earns about PHP 10,000 a month, and nothing makes him happier than seeing his children succeed in their studies. He joined GDMPC in 2009 and is applying for a loan for PHP 15,900 to buy fertilizer. His goal for the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. 

Alfredo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services. Alfredo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of coconuts to make copra

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Tessie is selling copra. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of coconut to make copra. Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coconut to make copra

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: A woman who has very beautiful face and kind-heart is Mahbuba. She is operose, talanted and brainy. Mahbuba has liked nuts since she was a child, and 20 years ago she began her own business selling nuts and dried fruits. Nowadays she is one of the successful business ladies in the local market. She has wide assortment of goods and that's why her goods attract many customers.She tries to be the best in business struggle. Her friends know her as kind and cute. She has a friendly family. Her husband is a pensioner and Mahbuba must work hard for improving their living conditions. Mahbuba has three smart children and tries to do the best for them. From profit she is going to enter his children to good schools.  She is asking for a loan to buy nuts and dried fruits for developing her business. Please, help her if you can, because she needs your support.

loans.use: To buy nuts and dried fruits for developing business

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en:
Teodorico is married with 4 children. Teodorico is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Teodorico is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 11 years and every month he earns 2,630 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Teodorico has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. 

In the future, Teodorico hopes to finish the education of his children and to gain double income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Bernadus

texts.en:
Bernadus, 38, is married to Teny, 36. They have 3 children, ages between 16 and 10 years old. All of the children are attending school. To make money for his family, Bernadus is working as a laborer at a local harbor. The small income that he gets from being a laborer led him to initiate a new business- to supply petrol and kerosene for the boats. Once a week, Bernadus buys 200 liters of fuel and resells it to the fishermen as they’ll need it for their boats' fuel. 

Even though Bernadus has 2 sources of income, he is struggling in meeting his family needs. Recently, Bernadus needed money for his children's schooling fees and also for his business. He would like to purchase more fuel to be resold. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 IDR. The loan would enable Bernadus to fulfill the educational fees of his children as well as to buy more petrol to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel and to fulfill the educational needs of his children

loans.name: Diogracia

texts.en:
Diogracia is 57 years old and lives in Cavite, Philippines with her two children. She earns at least PHP 500 a day by running a tailoring business where she makes and repairs items such as school uniforms, polo clothing, and curtains and other items used in the home. Her regular customers are her neighbors.

To continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy supplies such as fabric and thread. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and work hard to provide her family with a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en: Laurita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last 11 years, she has earned a living by running a food/retail (or sari-sari) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, items used in the home and beverages. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year and hopes to improve her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en: Fredelyn is a married and has three children. She is 41 years old, and resides at Canibungan, Daku, Clarin, Philippines. Fredelyn owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been 8 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 9,800 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Fredelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Fredelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian, a 32-year-old man, is married to Maria, a 26-year-old woman. They have been blessed with 4 sons, namely: Fernando, 7 years old, is attending second grade of elementary school; Okan, 6 years old, is attending first grade of elementary school; Evan, 1 year old; and Carlos, 7 months old.

Christian is working as employee at a private enterprise. From this job, Christian is able to generate regular income for his family. Unfortunately, the income generated from the job is small and insufficient to fully cover his family's needs. Christian then decided to run a motor taxi business after work hours in order to generate extra income for his beloved family. 

Looking at Christian’s efforts to support his family, Maria then also intends to take part in generating extra income for their family. Maria used to sell kitchen equipment but the capital has been spent on their children's schooling. Maria would like to continue her business to support Christian in meeting their family needs. Therefore, Christian is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 IDR to buy more kitchen equipment, i.e. frying pans, cooking pots, water dispensers, rice cookers, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen equipment, i.e. frying pans, cooking pots, water dispensers, rice cookers, etc. to resell

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en: Victoriana is married with 5 kids. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. Victoriana is a farmer and she operates a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Victoriana has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Victoriana hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 

Cerelina has a store that sells green bananas. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more green bananas to sell. Cerelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cerelina hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of green bananas to sell

loans.name: Marince

texts.en:
Marince, 32 years old, is married to Maksi, 39 years old. They have three children: Nando (11), Resma (6) and Richard (4). Nando and Resma are attending school. To make a living, Marince became an entrepreneur while her husband works as a building construction laborer. 

Marince initiated her small kiosk at home last year using her own capital. With the limited capital that she had, she could only sell limited products i.e. sugar, betel vine, snacks, detergent, instant noodles, cigarettes, shampoo, etc..

Marince would like to improve her business to generate more income as she realized that her children will need a lot of money for their educational costs. She would like to build a small kiosk in front of her house and provide various daily needs i.e. cooking oil, bath soap, mobile phone recharges, etc.. To be able to implement her plan, Marince then requested a loan from TLM amounting to 3,000,000 IDR. She is expecting that the loan assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to provide various daily needs, i.e. cooking oil, bath soap, mobile phone recharges, etc.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto  es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia, la misma ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de doce horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para el mantenimiento de su vehículo y es de mucha necesidad por que es la  única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Jacinto, es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la novena vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Jacinto’s married and has two school age children.  They all live in his house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He only completed secondary school and now works as a driver for more than 12 hours daily and well into the night because he’s the only wage-earner to cover family food, education and medical expenses.  This is why he requests the loan because what little he earns is insufficient to service his vehicle and this is very necessary because it’s his only source of income to support his family.  Jacinto’s dream is to improve his income and his quality of life.  This is the 9th time he’s requested credit from IMPRO and the second from KIVA.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже в третий раз пользуется кредитными услугами КИВА. Каждый раз своевременная помощь давала ее бизнесу шанс расширяться и развиваться, а семья могла за этот счет достойно жить, несмотря на непростое состояние экономики и постоянный рост цен на всё. Со времени выдачи предыдущего кредита Татьяна смогла на полученный доход сделать капитальный ремонт в квартире, поменять окна, отремонтировать кухню, ванную и туалет, что ей так давно хотелось сделать. 

Татьяна хотела бы вложить полученные средства в размере 15 000 гривен в покупку косметических средств и дорогой бижутерии из Германии, чтобы реализовать их в своем торговом павильоне и получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Tatyana is using the Kiva loan program for the third time. Each time, the timely help provided her business an opportunity to grow and evolve, thanks to which Tatyana’s family was able to enjoy dignified living conditions in spite of difficult economic times and ongoing overall price hikes. Since her last loan, Tatyana has been able to complete a full renovation of her apartment, install new windows, and renovate the kitchen, bath and toilet, which is something she had wanted to do for a long time.

Tatyana would like to invest the obtained 15,000 UAH into buying cosmetics and high-end fashion jewelry from Germany, in order to sell these wares in her store and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and high-end fashion jewelry from Germany.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es soltero y tiene un hijo, vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra.
Actualmente trabaja de empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos también debe darle una mensualidad a su hijo por que no vive con el, es por eso que solícita el crédito ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para el pago de sus estudios y desea estudiar contabilidad para mejorar  sus ingresos.
El sueño de José, es terminar sus estudios y mejorar sus ingresos para poder solventar los estudios de su hijo y su manutención.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez  junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
José’s single and has a son.  He lives in his house occupying one room with brick walls and a dirt floor.  He currently works as an employee in a private firm more than 8 hours daily because he must cover his food and basic utilities costs; he must also give a monthly stipend for his son who does not live with him.  

Because of this he’s asking for a loan because what he earns is insufficient to pay for his studies and he wants to study accounting in order to improve his income.  José’s dream is to finish his studies and to improve his income in order to pay for his son’s schooling and support.  This is the third time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for his Accounting courses.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene un hijo, vive en el Municipio de Victoria, Yoro.
Doña Maria hace 10 años estableció un negocio de pulpería. Ella ofrece productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, maíz, harina, manteca, lácteos, etc. Doña Maria es una señora muy reconocida en la zona cuenta con sus propios clientes.  Ella inicio este negocio con la visión de crecer y tener sus propios ingresos que le permitieran ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
En la actualidad ella solicito un préstamo a Odef de 10,000 lempiras para compra de productos que tiene mayor demanda como  frijoles, arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, lácteos etc. Con esto aumentar su inventario y sus ingresos.
su meta es crecer económicamente y mejorar el local donde tiene ubicado el negocio.
texts.en:
María Elsa, 55, is married and her husband works in agriculture.  She has a son and lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  María opened a grocery store ten years ago.  She sells basic staple items like beans, rice, corn, flour, lard, dairy products, etc.  María is very well-known in the zone and has regular customers.  She started the business with the goal of crowing and earning her own income to help her husband with household expenses.

She’s currently asking ODEF for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy products in highest demand like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lard, dairy products, etc.  With this she will increase inventory and income.  Her goal is to grow economically and to make improvements to the locale where she has her store located

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alba Azucena

texts.es:
Alba tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre, y tiene 5 hijos, vive en el  Municipio de Victoria Yoro.
Alba  tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como: ropa de cama, ropa interior, pantalones, faldas, cortinas, calzado de diferentes estilos,  también vende medicamentos (pastillas, jarabes etc.) decidió establecer este negocio con el fin de tener sus propios recursos de donde mantener a su familia proporcionándole la ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
Actualmente solicita el cuarto  préstamo de 20,500 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en compra de mercadería como calzado, ropa de cama, ropa de segunda mano y medicamentos  para la venta.
Su plan es seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio y si poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alba, 36, is living in a common law relationship and has five children; she lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  She’s been selling merchandise like bed linens, underwear, pants, skirts, curtains, assorted styles of footwear and also medicine (pills, syrups, etc.) for three years with the goal of earning her own income to support her family and help her husband cover household expenses.

She is currently asking for her fourth loan in the amount of 20,500 lempiras to buy merchandise like footwear, bed linens, second-hand clothes and medicine to resell. Her plan is to continue working to make her business grow and to be able to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, a 24-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Guba, Clarin, Philippines where for the past six years she has owned and operated a farm growing corn for sale to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.

Perlita joined GDMPC in 2009 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis tiene 29 años y vive en la Libertad junto a su familia, su esposa es ama de casa y cuida de sus 2 hijos. Luis se dedica a la pesca artesanal trabajo que aprendió por sus suegros al casarse, empezó como ayudante de los pescadores en el negocio familiar, con el pasar los años fue adquiriendo destreza. De momento no cuenta con una embarcación de fibra propia por lo que utiliza la de sus suegros realizando de esta manera su labor diario. El horario de trabajo que mantiene es desde las tardes cuando salen alta mar hasta la madruga que regresa con l producto de pesca para su venta. Los productos en su mayoría son camarones, langosta y pescado los cuales vende por gaveta para los restaurant y por libra para el comercio minorista. Su mayor dificultad son los piratas quienes roban tanto motores como implementos de la  pesca y los productos, Luis comenta que una de sus mayores preocupaciones es quedarse varado en alta mar. Con el crédito comprara redes, atarrayas y hacer algunas adecuaciones a la embarcación ya que el salitre las deteriora. El sueño de Luis a futuro es poder tener su propia embarcación.
texts.en: Luis is 29 years old and lives in Libertad with his family. His wife is a housewife and cares for their two children. Luis works in small-scale fishing. He learned the work from his in-laws when he married. He began as an assistant to the fishermen in the family business. With the passing of the years he acquired skill. At this time he does not have his own fiber boat, so he uses his in-laws' boat, in this way doing his daily work. The working schedule that he keeps is from the afternoons, when they go out on the open sea, until dawn, when they return with the product of their fishing to sell. For the most part, the products are shrimp, lobster, and fish, which he sells by the crate to the restaurants and by the pound to the retail trade. His greatest difficulty is the pirates who steal motors as well as fishing equipment and the product. Luis comments that one of his greatest worries is being stranded on the open sea. With the loan, he will buy nets and casting nets and make some improvements on the boat, since the salt has deteriorated it. Luis's dream for the future is to be able to have his own boat.

loans.use: to buy nets and casting nets

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro tiene 56 años vive en la zona del plan 3000 en su casa propia es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que asisten a  la escuela, el y su esposa se dedican a la venta de comida, su venta está en la parada de la línea de micros de la zona,  El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, Venden desayuno y almuerzo, cuentan con el apoyo de una de sus hijas. El Sr. Pedro es una persona responsable, trabajadora se sacrifica mucho  para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, su deseo del Sr. Pedro es el ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Pedro, 56, lives in the Plan 3000 zone in his own house; he’s married and has four children attending school.  He and his wife work selling food at one of the local bus stops.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy ingredients to prepare the food.  They sell breakfast and lunch and one of their daughters helps them.  Pedro is a responsible, hardworking man who sacrifices much in order to give his children a good education.  Pedro’s wish is to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Amigas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE CORAZON” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, pollereria, venta de CD’s, tienda de barrio, venta de ollas, tejido de chompa de alpaca, venta de pollos a la brosthers, venta de comida.

La señora Herminia, indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio  elaboración y venta de polleras, ella cuenta que empezó este negocio cuando ayudaba a su madre a realizar este trabajo y en la actualidad ella cuenta con su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de materia prima (compra de telas) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias de fin de semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Corazón” communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Herminia, President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have clothing sales, chicken sales, CD sales, neighborhood store, pots sales, alpaca wool sweater making, Broasted chicken sales and food sales.

Herminia says that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from a member of the institution.  She currently has a business making and selling skirts.  She relates that she started the business when she used to help her mother do this kind of work and she now has her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy raw materials (fabric) from suppliers in the city of El Alto and after making them she’ll sell them in the weekend street markets.  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her family the best way possible since she’s single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation in Vazashen village, Tavush region. He rears cows, calves, pigs, and two horses as well. Artak produces meat, milk and butter, which he sells in his village. He also grows figs, Oriental persimmons and nuts to sell. Artak grows vegetables for his family’s use. He has two trucks which he and his father use to transport produce and cows and calves in the mountains. He fulfills private orders for transportation as well. 

Thanks to his occupations, Artak supports his family and he was also able to pay for his sisters’ education, organize his wedding, repair his house, buy necessary furniture, and buy two trucks.

Artak is 27 years old. He lives in Vazashen village with his parents, two sisters and his wife. Artak’s parents help him with his agricultural activities. His elder sister is a teacher at school. His wife and younger sister are jobless. 

Artak is asking for a 600,000 dram loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem runs a garden in Khashtarak village, Tavush region. He grows haricots, onions, potatos, and maize (corn). Also, Artem has some apple and Oriental persimmon trees. He sells fruits and vegetables in Khashtarak village and in Ijevan city as well. Artem’s family helps him in gardening and thus they support themselves.
Artem likes his occupation very much. He says that gardening is laborious and at the same time a profitable business, so he intends to develop it. He needs a $3,000 loan to fence his garden and to install an irrigation system in it. 
Artem is 34 years old. He is married and has two school-aged sons. Also with them lives Artem’s mother, who works as a teacher at school. Along with his agricultural activities, Artem works as an accountant at one of Ijevan’s organizations.

loans.use: to fence his garden and to install an irrigation system in it.

loans.name: Rosa Aurelia

texts.es:
Rosa Aurelia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y cuenta con un hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo. Su vivienda se encuentra situada en el caserío Totoral Bajo, una comunidad rural situada a treinta minutos del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. Su comunidad se encuentra poblada por gente humilde con deseos de superación. Por el momento ya cuenta con servicios básico de luz. 

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y venta de animales entre ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, ella cria sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando alcanzan un desarrollo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y eventualmente en el mercado del distrito, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace aproximadamente siete años. Además junto a su esposo, cuentan con un terreno agricola donde tiene sembrado mango y maíz, con los ingresos que ambos obtienen de estas actividades ellos se encargan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Rosa Aurelia desea adquirir alimento balanceado y granos al por mayor para poder mejorar la alimentación de sus animales, asimismo desea mejorar sus corrales. Con esta inversión sus animales se desarrollarán de mejor modo y podán venderse a un mejor precio.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y con esa ayuda pudo aumentar sus ingresos ya que con los alimentos que compró sus animales desarrollaron del modo esperado y fueron vendidos a un mejor precio, por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en aquella oportunidad y también aprovecha la oportunidad para agradecer de antemano a las personas que le ayuden en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurelia, 52, is married and has one dependent son.  She lives in her own house with her husband and son.  The house is located in Totoral Bajo, a rural community located thirty minutes from the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  Her community is populated by humble people who want to improve.  At the moment it already has electricity.

The activity she carries out is raising sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl to sell.  She raises her animals in her back yard.  When they develop sufficiently she sells them to area merchants and sometimes in the district market.  She’s been in this business for about 7 years.  In addition, together with her husband she owns a parcel of land where they have planted mangoes and corn.  With income they both earn from these activities they support their family.

Rosa Aurelia wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed and grains at wholesale to improve her animals’ nutrition; she also wants to make improvements to her corrals.  With this investment her animals will develop better and will be sold at a better price.

She has already had a loan financed through Kiva and with that support was able to increase her income since the animals she bought developed properly and were sold at a better price.  Because of this she’s quite grateful to the people who collaborated with her on that occasion and also avails herself of this opportunity to thank those who will support her now in advance.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and repair her corrals.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 30 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Mirasol has a food/retail shop or 'sari-sari' store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 6 years. 

Mirasol has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mirasol hopes to grow her income from the business, for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with one child. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. Ruth is a farmer, and she manages corn production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 28 years, and every month she earns 5,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase fertilizer. Ruth has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Ruth hopes to be able to afford further education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, wholesale noodles, drinks, and canned goods, among others.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica  is  50  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Veronica has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Veronica  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future,Veronica hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. She previously accessed a 45,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw materials needed in her jewellery business. Her earnings were a big help with the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to have additional capital and to buy more materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Josephine dreams of expanding her store and to be able to pay the loan that she is paying in installments through all her hard work on her business. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in the family's jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Salvacion has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math is a 31-year-old married woman living in Reussey Keo district, a suburb of Phnom Penh. She and her husband are both garment factory workers, but they are employed in different factories and in different positions. Math works as a sewing staff, while her husband is an expert at repairing engines. They do not have any children, but they plan to start a family soon. 

In order to supplement the family’s income, Math’s husband wants to get involved in the used motorcycle business. He will purchase used motorcycles from local people at an acceptable price, and sell them to others at a profit.  Math's husband has sufficient engineering skills to refurbish the motorbike's engines. However, he does not have enough capital to start up the business. 

To help her husband in his new business, Math would like to take out a loan of USD 1,500 to buy used motorcycles for resale. Math and her husband hope that the loan will enable them to increase their household income, and earn a good living in the  future.

loans.use: to buy used motorcycles for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 24 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living operating a fish pond in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her business.

Alma has been operating the fish pond for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and farming rice. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additonal feed for her fish business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 30 years old and married, with one child in school. Angela works very hard to provide for her family.

Angela runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Angela would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his chicken business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia runs a business direct-selling Natasha, Avon, and MSE products in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Arsenia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shoes, t-shirt, and sandals. In the future Arsenia would like to save enough to provide for the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edwin Arcides

texts.es:
Edwin, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, el cual invertirá en la reparación de un vehículo, pues trabaja comprando, reparando y vendiendo vehículos, en este caso cambiara el sistema electrico y el tapizado del vehiculo, con este cambio estara listo para poderlo poner a la venta. 
Considera que estos préstamos le han servido para mantenerse en el negocio, pues le proporcionan necesarios para continuar trabajando, recibiendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin decided to request a new loan so that he can invest in his vehicle repair business.  His work involves buying, repairing, and selling vehicles, and in this case he will be changing out the electrical system and the upholstery of the vehicle.  Once the vehicles are repaired, he is able to sell them.  

Edwin says that the loans have helped him to maintain his business.  They have given him what he needs to continue working so that he can generate income for his family.

loans.use: to change out the electrical system and the upholstery in order to sell this vehicle

loans.name: Ema Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Ema tiene 50 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Barrio Nuevo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Ema va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada de invierno como chompas y chamarras,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo que hace mucho frio y tiene mucha demanda de estos productos, la Sra. Ema enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia por los precios y la falta de capital y  va a utilizar los beneficios para la compra de ropa según a la temporada en la compra de ropa de invierno por la época y la demanda. Su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda propia ya que alquila una tienda y este gasto del alquiler quiere invertir en su hogar, la Sra. Ema se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ema, age 50, sells clothes and cosmetics at a stand in the Barrio Nuevo area.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Ema will use this loan to buy seasonal winter clothing like sweaters and jackets.  

Her reason for requesting this loan is that it is very cold, and there is a lot of demand for these products.  Ema faces challenges in her business, which are competitive prices and the lack of capital.  She will use the profits to buy clothes according to the season and the demand.

Her wish for her business is to have her own store.  She now rents a store, and she wants to use the rent expense to invest in her home.  

Ema is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal winter clothing like sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera necesaria la inversión en la compra de materiales para continuar en la reparación del techo del negocio como son láminas, polines, mano obra, ya que del prestamo anterior no le alcanzo los fondos para finalizar toda la reparacion en el negocio, cubriendo solo una parte de las galeras donde a diario vende tortillas, quiere estar preparada para enfrentar el invierno, con una mejor condición.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprase una parte de los materiales que ya instalo en el negocio, tambien a fortalecer las ventas en el negocio, ha logrado invertir varios prestamos que han sido utilizados para distintas cosas, en este tiempo ha logrado invertir de sus ganancias para mantenerse competente, en su familia su situación está mejorando.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan, as she needs to pay for labor and supplies to continue with the repair of the roof of her business, such as sheets of corrugated metal, poles, and labor.  This is because with the previous loan, she did not have sufficient funds to finish all the repairs for her business; she covered only a part of the galleys where she sells tortillas daily.  She wants her business to be in better condition so that it will be prepared for winter.  

She states that the previous loan helped her to buy some of the materials that she already installed in her business, and also helped strengthened her sales.  She has received various loans in the past and has been able to use them for various purposed, and so over this time she has managed to invest her earnings to stay competitive, and her family's situation is improving.

loans.use: Compra de láminas, polines, mano obra.

loans.name: Rosa Belen

texts.es: Rosa vive en Libertad donde tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. A sus 21 años emprendió el negocio porque considero que de alguna manera debía ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo es albañil en este tipo de trabajo la labor es ocasional y cuando no tiene contratos se han encontrado en problemas económicos sobre todo con la llegada de sus hijos. Hace 2 años que empezó la tienda y le va muy bien, ella la administra y atiende empezando desde muy temprano en la mañana, como está ubicada en su domicilio tiene la facilidad de cuidar a sus hijos sin problemas. En ella vende arroz, azúcar, granos, verduras, etc., lo que espera comprar cuando le aprueben el crédito. Espera a futuro ampliar su negocio y así ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Rosa lives in Libertad where she has a small store where she sells basic necessities. She opened the store when she was 21 years old because she decided that she had to help out with the household expenses in some way. Her husband is a bricklayer and his work is sporadic. When he has no contracts they have found themselvesin financial trouble, especially after the children came. Two years ago she started the store and it is going very well for her. She manages it and works there starting very early in the morning. Since it is located in her home she can take care of her children easily. She sells rice, sugar, grains, etc., which she hopes to buy when the loan is approved.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия уже в третий раз обращается за кредитом к КИВА. Данные кредитные услуги значительно способствовали улучшению состояния ее бизнеса: по сравнению с предыдущим периодом прошлого года, сумма выручки и доход увеличились. Наталия смогла также расширить свой ассортимент товара и увеличить достаток семьи. 
Наталия планирует использовать полученную от КИВА сумму в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести разнообразную посуду, белорусский хрусталь и сувениры для последующей реализации в своем торговом киоске. В этот период торговля не очень хорошая, но и не плохая, поэтому собственных средств на пополнение оборота сейчас не хватает, а товар нужно подкупить, чтобы было чем торговать до декабря, так как в августе много приезжих покупателей.
texts.en: Nataliya is requesting a loan from Kiva for the third time.  These credit services contributed significantly to her business condition: the profit amount and income increased compared to the previous period of last year.  Nataliya was also able to expand her merchandise selection and improve the family's welfare.  She plans to use this Kiva loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase various dishware, Belorussian crystal and souvenirs for subsequent sale at her retail kiosk.  This is the period when sales are neither very good nor bad, and this is why she does not have her own means to increase turnover, but needs to purchase enough merchandise to last until December because there are a lot of visiting customers in August.

loans.use: to purchase various dishware, Belorussian crystal and souvenirs for subsequent sale at her retail kiosk

loans.name: Margaritas 15 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS 15 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pijamas, fritura de papa y postre, venta de celulares, venta de ropa, venta de batidos y licuados, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado, venta de fruta.

La señora Gregoria, indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de frituras de papas, postres y habas, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por su hijastra quien le enseño el oficio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de papa y aceite) mismo que comprará de los almacenes de comercio y posteriormente a la preparación los comercializará de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en diferentes zonas de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud por el apoyo que les brinda.
texts.en:
The “MARGARITAS 15 DE JULIO” comunal bank is in its first cycle with  Pro Mujer, as a part of the Santiago II focal center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors with Gregoria as its president. The businesses that the members of the bank have are varied. Among them we have: sewing pajamas, french fries and desserts, selling cell phones, selling clothes, selling batidos and smoothies, a neighborhood store, selling fish and selling fruit.

Gregoria indicates that this is the second year that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation of a friend, who is a member of our institution. Right now she has a business selling french fries, desserts and beans. She reports that she started this business because of her stepdaughter, who taught her the business.

The loan that she will rnow take out is to grow her capital (buying potatoes and oil). She will buy these from the bigger stores and after preparation will sell them as a street vendor (with no set sales point) in different areas of the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to make resources to support her family as much as she can. She is divorced and has eight children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health part of it because of the support they offer.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and oil

loans.name: Glenda Gissella

texts.es: Glenda vive en Paraíso junto a sus padres e hija, tiene 22 años y por circunstancias de la vida es madre soltera. Es este acontecimiento lo que ha fortificado su carácter y la impulso a buscar una manera de ganar dinero. Glenda se dedica a la venta de productos relacionados a la belleza femenina maquillaje, perfume, joyas, sombras, lápiz labiales etc., también vende productos para hombre y niños. Realiza la venta y promoción sola todos los días ya que visita al cliente para recoger los pedidos que le hacen, este negocio le deja buenos beneficios y gracias a él ha podido salir adelante con su hijo. Glenda espera poder conseguir el crédito ya que con el comprara mercadería para la venta, esto lo hace porque desea tener más producción  ya que en próximos meses su hijo ingresara a la escuela por lo que aumentaran sus gastos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y llegar a ser directora de una de las marcas que vende.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in Paraíso with her parents and her child.  Glenda is 22 years old, and due to life’s circumstances, she is a single mother.  It is this event that  fortified her character and drove her to look for a way to earn money.

Glenda sells women’s beauty products like make-up, perfume, jewelry, eye shadow, and lipsticks, etc.  She also sells products for men and children.  She promotes and sells her products by herself every day because she visits her customers to take their orders.  This business gives her good profits, and thanks to that she has been able to get ahead with her child.

Glenda hopes to be able to get the loan.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to sell.  She will do this because she wishes to have greater production.  In the coming months her child will go to school, and her expenses will increase.  Her goal for the future is to expand the business and to become a director of one of the brands that she sells.

loans.use: to buy make-up, perfume, jewelry, eye shadow, and lipsticks, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bronislava

texts.ru:
Бронислава из Новой Каховки. Она пенсионерка и вдова. У Брониславы два взрослых сына. Она арендует торговое место у одного из местных рынков, торгуя мужской одеждой, рубашками и спортивной одеждой вот уже 18 лет. 

Брониславе необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию рубашек, маек, футболок и свитеров на осень по выгодной цене. Она планирует дальше развивать свое дело, занимаясь бизнесом и, тем самым, обеспечивая себя и свою семью нужными средствами к существованию.
texts.en: Bronislava is from Novaya Kahovka.  She is a retiree and a widow.  Bronislava has two adult sons.  She has been leasing a retail space from one of the local markets and selling men's clothing, shirts and athletic wear there for 18 years.  Bronislava needs a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase an inventory of shirts, tank tops, t-shirts and sweaters at an advantageous price for the autumn.  She plans to continue developing her business; thus, providing herself and her family with the necessary means to live.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of shirts, tank tops, t-shirts and sweaters at an advantageous price for the autumn

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia.  She has previously taken and repayed a loan of 9,000 Philippe Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy merchandise that she resold in her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Delia would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise, to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display, and available on hand, the better. Delia hopes that having more items to sell will result in a better profit.  The income from the business will help her to sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Delia hopes to be more successful in her business, and dreams of having her own house and plot through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise ordered for her customers

loans.name: Letty Maritza

texts.es: En la ciudad de Playas vive Letty quien tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su casa es propia y cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y camino pavimentado. Hace 10 años se construyo un parque en su barrio por lo que era muy concurrido, esto la llevo a ponerse la despensa, con el pasar de los años y gracias al gobierno que regenero el sector para atraer el turismo su sector es ahora conocido como el varadero. En la actualidad su negocio es el mejor ubicado por lo que tiene mucha clientela, labora de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, sus mejores días son los fines de semana por el aumento de viajeros. Letty atiende sola el negocio el cual le permite ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela. Su esposo es pescador y sus hijos estudian en colegios fiscales. Al momento de obtener el préstamo va a comprar confitería, víveres, gaseosas, con esto mejorar su negocio en ventas y ganancias.
texts.en: In the city of Playas lives Letty, who is 40 and sells groceries. She owns her own home, which has electricity, running water and is on a paved road. Ten years ago, a park was built in her neighborhood and so a lot of people go there. This led to her opening a store and over the years and thanks to the government, which regenerated the area to attract tourists, the place is now known as El Varadero. Right now, her business is in the best location and she has a lot of customers. She works from Monday through Sunday from 8 of the morning until 7 at night. Her best days are on weekends with the increase in travelers. Letty works in her business alone and this allows her to help her children with their homework. Her husband is a fisherman and her children go to public schools. When she gets this loan she is going to buy pastries, groceries, soft drinks and thus improve her business with better sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy pastries, groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru:
Алла – вдова. Она живет в Запорожье. Она работает на одном из самых крупных местных рынков города. Алла зарабатывает на жизнь, торгуя кормами для животных и сопутствующими товарами, а именно ошейниками, клетками и прочим. У Аллы 3 прилавка: один собственный и еще два арендованных. Торговлей данным видом товара она занимается уже 8 лет.  
Алла обратилась в Кива за кредитом в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сухой корм для животных, консервы и реконструировать свой торговый прилавок, сделав его более удобным для услуг по продаже товаров для животных. Полученную дополнительную прибыль Алла намерена потратить на развитие бизнеса и личные нужды.
texts.en: Alla is a widow.  She lives in Zaporozhye.  She works at one of the largest local markets in the city.  Alla earns a living by selling pet food and pet supplies, such as collars, cages and the like.  Alla has three counters: one is her own and two more leased.  She has been selling this type of merchandise for eight years.  Alla requested a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia from Kiva to purchase dry and canned pet food and to remodel her retail counter, making it more convenient for her to sell pet food.  Alla intends to use the additional profit for business development and personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase dry and canned pet food and to remodel her retail counter

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 60-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and only one child who is still studying. She and her husband collaborate together in order to pay their family expenses and their child’s educational fees. Dalal has been working independently as a babysitter since 2005. She has more than twenty years of experience in this domain. She visits her customers at home and also welcomes some of them at her place. As for her husband, he has been working as a furniture painter. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate the room in which she babysits the kids. This Kiva loan will improve the place and allow her to attract more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own nursery.

loans.use: to renovate the room in which she babysits kids

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the sale of decorative products. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as blouses, pants, bags and other decorative products. Marilyn has sustained her business through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to save enough money so she can attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as blouses, pants, bags and other decorative products.

loans.name: Alan Uriel

texts.es:
El joven Alan es habitante de Estelí, tiene 21 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a brindar el servicio de nintenderia en su comunidad, casado, padre de 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, el realizo estudios hasta quinto año de secundaria. Alan inicio su actividad desde hace un año con dinero propio, anteriormente trabajaba  en una empresa privada, de lo que recibió de la liquidación decide poner su negocio propio en su casa de habitación ya que quería ser alguien independiente, este ha sido su primer negocio el cual saca adelante por si solo, Alan se siente satisfecho con su nintenderia porque es un negocio rentable, genera ingresos diarios además cuenta con clientes fijos especialmente los niños que viven en la comunidad y llegan a su nintenderia a entretenerse con los vídeos juegos que les ofrece Alan.
Solicita el crédito   para comprar un televisor, cables de alta definición, lentes para xbox y un disco duro, todos los equipos necesarios para mantener su negocio activo, el dice que el préstamo será de ayuda porque podrá  invertir en nuevos equipos para su nintenderia, que permitirá brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del  negocio para mayor atracción de clientes con el objetivo de obtener mas ganancias para el hogar, su meta próxima es llegar a sacar su licenciatura para ser una persona mejor preparada, tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo y obtener otros ingresos para poder salir adelante con la familia.
texts.en:
Alan, 21, is a young man living in Estelí.  He’s a merchant by profession offering Nintendo services in his community.  He’s married and the father of one son who is in his care.  He completed 11th grade.

Alan started his activity a year ago with money of his own.  He used to work for a private firm and used his severance pay to open his own, home-based business because he wanted to be independent.  This is the first business he’s been working on for himself.  Alan feels satisfied with his Nintendo arcade because it’s a profitable business; it generates income daily and he has regular customers especially children who live in the community and come to his Nintendo arcade to entertain themselves with the video games Alan offers.

He’s asking for the loan to buy a television set, high definition cables, Xbox goggles and a hard drive.  All of this equipment is necessary in order to keep the business active.  He says that the loan will be of help to him because he’ll be able to invest in new equipment for his Nintendo arcade that will make it possible for him to provide better customer service.  His future plan is to expand the area of the business to attract more customers in order to earn higher profits for his home.  His next goal is to get his bachelor’s degree to be a better-prepared person and to have better employment opportunities and earn other income to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy a television set, high definition cables, Xbox goggles and a hard drive.

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad; Diego es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajador, que con ayuda de su pareja dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, día a día Diego trabaja como obrero en una empresa de carga pesada de su ciudad, él labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su trabajo de vigia cuadrador y cree que le va bien porque lo consideran por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Diego se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que actualmente Diego y su familia viven en una casita construida de esteras y palos, y pasan en la época de invierno cuando la temperatura baja, pasan mucho frío y sufren por las lluvias; de esta manera Diego podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia y en futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su casa construida totalmente.
texts.en:
Diego is a 21-year-old man living in the city of Chincha with his spouse and little one-year-old son.  Diego is a very kind, enthusiastic and hardworking person who with his spouse’s help puts all his efforts into moving his family forward.  In his free time he enjoys relaxing listening to a little music and sometimes cooks a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” to share with his family.

With much dedication, Diego works day to day as a laborer in a heavy cargo firm in his city.  He works about 10 hours daily and feels good doing his work as a watchman and he believes that he does well because he’s esteemed for the good work he does and the kind way he treats others.

Diego is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to add a room to his house since currently Diego and his family live in a little house made out of matting and sticks and during the winter when temperatures drop they are cold and suffer a lot because of the rain.  In this way, Diego will be able to offer more safety and wellbeing to his family and in the not too distant future he’ll be able to have his house built completely.

loans.use: to add a room to his house.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 50 years old   She is married and has 6 children. Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela una pequeña empresaria bastante empeñosa y tenaz, ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y lo ha pagado puntualmente. Durante el ultimo año le han pasado muchas cosas positivas, la mejor de todas es que se casó y actualmente ha adecuado su estilo de vida a su nueva situación, su esposo cuenta con un negocio de agroquímicos y ambos se encuentran con la esperanza y el optimismo de salir adelante y forjar un mejor porvenir para su familia.

Con tan solo 22 años de  edad, Mariela ha demostrado la madurez necesaria para poder trabajar y salir adelante, se dedica a las actividades comerciales desde hace tres años. En su préstamo anterior trabajaba vendiendo cosméticos y actualmente, gracias a su habilidad para los negocios ha instalado en su domicilio una bodega. 

En su bodega se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, bebidas y accesorios que comercializa entre sus vecinos, su carisma y buena atención hacen que su negocio siempre cuente con clientela estable, su esposo la apoya en las actividades que realiza. Actualmente Mariela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de primera necesidad, bebidas y golosinas. Con esta inversión ella ampliará su negocio y podrá aumentar sus ingresos, a la vez que ayudará a sus vecinos a agenciarse de productos facilmente, ya que la zona donde residen se encuentra bastante alejada del pueblo.

Mariela desea agradecer a las personas que le apoyaron en su primer préstamo y también desea agradecer de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Mariela’s quite a tenacious, enterprising businesswoman.  She’s had a previous Kiva loan that she repaid punctually.  During the last year many positive things have happened to her the best of which is she got married and she’s adjusted her lifestyle to this new reality.  Her husband has a farm chemicals business and they are both hopeful and optimistic about getting ahead together and to forge a better future for their family.

At the young age of 22, Mariela has shown the necessary maturity to be able to work and to get ahead.  She’s been carrying out commercial activities for three years.  During her previous loan she worked selling cosmetics and currently thanks to her business skills she’s opened a home-based general store.

In her store she sells basic staple items, groceries, beverages and accessories to her neighbors.  Her charisma and good service lead to her store’s having a regular clientele to depend on.  Her husband supports her in her activities.  

Currently, Mariela wants to expand the business buying more basic staple items, beverages and snacks.  With this investment she will expand the business and be able to increase her income while helping her neighbors to access products easily since the zone they live in is quite far from the town.

Mariela wants to thank the people who supported her with her first loan and also wants to thank in advance those who will support her now.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Aniceta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice and feeds to sell.

NWTF is relisting Aniceta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice and feeds to sell.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn works hard to support her family. Bebelyn is married and has vegetable business in the Philippines.  Bebelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Bebelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional  vegetable to sell

loans.name: Jorge Libardo

texts.es: Jorge tiene 50 años y vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil zona periurbana de Guayaquil. El se dedica a la confección de zapatos de cuero para la venta al mayor y menor. Este oficio lo realiza desde que tenía 16 años de edad ya que lo aprendió de sus padres, al principio solo trabaja de ayudante pero cuando su esposa lo abandono decidió comprar una maquina y poner el negocio de manera independiente. La decisión que tomo fue muy acertada ya que desde ese momento mejoraron sus ganancias y ha podido brindarles seguridad a sus hijos. En su domicilio arreglo su sala donde ubico la máquina de coser y la cortadora, también tiene unas perchas para colocar la mercadería una vez terminada. El trabajo lo realiza todos los días y le ayudan sus 2 hijos en la mañana porque en la tarde asisten al colegio. Con el crédito que está solicitando comprara cuero y plantillas para la producción de las zapatillas. Jorge tiene 4 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio particular su sueño es poder ayudarle a sus hijos con los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jorge, 50, lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, a periurban zone in Guayaquil.  He manufactures leather shoes to sell at wholesale and retail.  He’s been doing this since he was 16-years-old since he learned it from his parents.  

At first, he only worked as an assistant but when his wife abandoned him he decided to buy a machine and open his own business.  The decision was a good one because since then his profits improved and he’s been able to provide security for his children.  

He set aside a room in his house where he installed his sewing machine and the cutting machine.  He also has some shelves to display the merchandise once it’s finished.  He works every day and his two children help him in the morning because they attend school in the afternoon. 

He will use the requested loan to buy leather and soles to make sandals.  Jorge has four children attending private school and his dream is to be able to help them with their university education.

loans.use: to buy leather and soles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married and has 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emily is 27 years old and has 2 children who are in school.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  Emily has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Doña Sonia de 51 años de edad, es originaria de Condega municipio de Estelí, ella además de ser licenciada en Biología es  comerciante,  madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta a su cargo, Sonia es dueña de una pulpería desde hace 4 años la cual tiene en su casa de habitación. Inicio su negocio con dinero propio que tenia ahorrado pues su deseo era ser alguien independiente, además quería generar ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, decide poner su propia pulpería, este ha sido su primer negocio en el cual se siente satisfecha pues cuenta con clientes fijos.
Sonia quiere invertir más  en su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes es por esta razón que requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, jabón, huevo, pan, leche, jugos, avena, etc. El cual estima será de ayuda porque podrá surtir su pulpería con productos variados especialmente los mas solicitados por sus clientes, incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mas ganancias para la familia, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y diversificarse en productos pues desea poder ofrecer materiales de ferretería con el objetivo de tener un negocio mas surtido y poder obtener mejores ingresos, espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para cumplir sus sueños y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 51, is from Condega, Estelí Municipality.  Besides having a bachelor’s degree in Biology, she’s also a merchant and the mother of four children only the youngest of which is still in her care.  

Sonia has been the owner of a grocery store for four years that’s located at home.  She started the business with her own money that she’d saved up because she wanted to be an independent person.  She also wanted to earn income to help with household expenses.  She decided to open her own grocery store which is her first business and which she’s satisfied with because she has a regular clientele.

Sonia wants to invest more in her business to meet customer demand which is why she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, soap, eggs, bread, milk, juice, oatmeal, etc. that she believes will be of great help to her because she’ll be able to stock her store with varied products especially those most requested by her customers.  Her sales will increase generating more profits for the family at the same time.  

Her future plan is to expand the size of the store and to diversify her products because she wants to start to sell hardware items in order to have more variety and to earn higher income.  She hopes to have Kiva’s support to make her dreams a reality and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stock needed for her rice-selling business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie. She previously borrowed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase additional supplies of chicken and pork. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and pay for personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Lanie hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rosalina is selling snacks in the school canteen near her family's house. She has run this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients used for making snacks like flour, sugar, cheese, and juices.
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used for making snacks.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 53 years old, from Baclayon, Bohol. She is a fish vendor in the community of Taguihon. Josefina's husband is a fisherman and whatever he catches from a night of fishing she will sell in the neighborhood in the  morning. She has four children ages 13, 17, 18 and 22. Because of them, she works hard so she can support the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon for fishing net repair, and fishing hooks. She will do everything so that her business will be successful and profitable, making her family's life better. Her income will be for school fees and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy nylon for fishing net repair, and fishing hooks

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, distrito que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros, asimismo se encuentran muchas empresas agroexportadoras las cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo en el distrito.
