loans.use: to buy beverages, meats, vegetables, dairy products and other supplies.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 25 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan de forma unida y tratan siempre de salir adelante y resolver los inconvenientes que surgen, es un grupo muy unido y trabajador.
Gabriela es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser de invierno, de verano y demás. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que es muy hábil con las ventas. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de ropas y de esa forma poder ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, camperas, pantalones, jeans y demás prendas, con las cuales podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos y las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is from the city of Coronel Oviedo; it has 25 members.  They all work together and try to always get ahead and solve any problems that arise; it’s a much unified, hardworking group.

Gabriela is a member of this group.  She sells all types of clothes for winter, summer and others.  She comments that she has a good clientele since she’s a very skillful salesperson.  Her goal is to have a great clothing store to become a micro businesswoman that way.

She’s asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, jackets, pants, jeans and other clothes to continue to fill orders and customer requests.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es socia del Bancomunal Milenio y tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y madre de tres hijas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa.
En todo este tiempo ella ha aprendido a ahorrar y a ser responsable. Su sueño para el futuro es tener una casa propia donde se puede vivir junto a sus hijas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa para vender.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a member of the Milenio communal bank. She is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of three daughters.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for three years, and she sells clothes.  In all of this time she has learned to save and to be responsible.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house where she will be able to live with her daughters.

She will use the requested loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 34 years old and married, with three children who are in school. She does tailoring to make a living. She has been in the business for six years and has one employee.  She also sells fish to generate extra income.

She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of KES 40,000 to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mujeres Laboriosas 2 Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se han unido con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren poder apoyar a sus hijos con su sacrificio.
Sandra es miembro, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buena venta, en especial los fines de semana. Su meta es poder ir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, y demás con lo que podrá surtirse y ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso have united with the purpose of helping their families through their work.  They are the heads of their households and want to be able to support their children through their sacrifices.

Sandra, a member of this group, sells beverages of every type.  She reports that she has a very good base of customers, and has very good sales, especially on the weekends.  Her goal is to be able to keep growing her business and thus be able to continue helping her family.

She is seeking this loan to purchase soda, wine, beer and other types of beverages so that she can stock her store and offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase soda, wine, beer and other items.

loans.name: Cledy

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Cledy, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella vende cosméticos y perfumería. Cledy invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería para su comercio, que le permitirá cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes.
Cledy está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cledy belongs to the “Cusco Sur” (Cusco South) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She sells beauty products like cosmetics and perfumes.  Cledy will use the requested loan to buy merchandise for her business that will make it possible for her to meet customer demand.

Cledy is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide a better quality of life for her family and for helping her to grow and strengthen her activity.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Dora Yanet

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Dora, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia trabaja en la administración pública, pero también se sigue dedicando a su actividad complementaria de elaboración de prendas de vestir principalmente de tejidos en fibra de lana. Dora invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar materiales de tejido como diversidad de lanas e hilos, que le permitirá cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes.
Dora está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Dora belongs to the “Cusco Sur” (Cusco South) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She works in public administration but also continues with her other activity which is making articles of clothing primarily out of wool yarn.  Dora will use the loan she’s requested to buy knitting supplies like a variety of wool and yarn that will make it possible for her to fill pending orders.

Dora is grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to improve her family’s quality of life and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her business.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase wool to knit sweaters

loans.name: Tavai Group

texts.es:
Tavai es un grupo muy trabajador de la ciudad de Santaní, son personas muy trabajadoras, se esfuerzan todos los días para poder ayudar a sus hijos y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Celina, la presidenta del grupo siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a que no se den por vencidas ya que gracias a este trabajo pueden ayudar a sus familias. Celina es modista y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le acercan los pedidos de trabajo para hacer. Cuenta que los trabajos que hacen son muy apreciados, y es por ello que tiene muchos clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, con lo cual quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes
texts.en:
“Tavai” is a very hardworking group from the city of Santaní.  They are very hardworking people who strive every day to help their children thus avoiding their having to go through any unmet needs like they themselves have had to go through.

Celina is group president and she always tries to motivate her fellow members so that they won’t give up because thanks to this work they can help their families.  Celina is a dressmaker and she relates that she has a good clientele that always come by to place orders with her.  She relates that the work she does is highly esteemed which is why she has many customers.

She requests the loan to buy fabric, thread, adhesives and others in order to fill all her pending customer orders.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
 
Analyn provides motorela, or motorcycle services, and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Analyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.en:
Sohibjamol’s name means "beautiful," and in reality, Sohibjamol is a very beautiful woman.  She is also a very successful business woman. 

For more than five years, she has been busy with her own business. She sells curtains. She has a wide assortment, and that’s why her goods attract many customers.  She has her own selling place in the local market. 

Sohibjamol is married and has three children. Her husband went to foreign countries to find a job. Sohibjamol must work hard to improve their family's living standard. 

She wants to develop her business further, but her income isn't enough for it. She is asking a loan to buy goods to widen the assortment of her goods. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods for a wider assortment to sell.

loans.name: Daybee

texts.en:
Daybee is 46 years old and married, with two children.

Daybee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Daybee has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Daybee aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Santa Maria 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Santa Maria 1 están en el séptimo Ciclo con 14  integrantes, todas ellas trabajan arduamente para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma salir adelante y también crecer.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, son mujeres sacrificadas y que buscan y anhelan un bienestar mejor a sus hijos. Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados y de esa forma poder seguir alimentando bien a sus animales. Agradece a la fundacion paraguaya y a kiva por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named "Santa Maria 1". They're in their 7th loan cycle. There are 14 members, all of whom work very hard in order to support each other, and therefore get ahead and also grow.
All of the members raise and sell animals. They're self-sacrificing women who seek and wish for better living conditions for their children. Maria requests the loan in order to purchase feed, so that she can continue to feed her animals well.
She gives thanks to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help that she and her friends are getting.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Jose, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio trabaja en la administración pública, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para pagar algunas deudas adquiridas anteriormente y para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Jose está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle apoyar a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: José belongs to the “Cusco Sur” (Cusco South) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He works in public administration and this activity makes it possible for him to support his family but will use this loan he’s requested to pay off some previously-incurred debts and for his home’s maintenance.  José is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for him to support his family.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to pay debts and to buy food.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Víctor, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose a la contabilidad, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para implementar su estudio contable y compró mobiliario como implementos de oficina.
Víctor está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Víctor belongs to the “Cusco Sur” (Cusco South) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He continues working in accounting, an activity that makes it possible for him to support his family but he’s asking for the loan to set up his accounting office; he bought furniture and office supplies.  Víctor is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for him to stay in business supporting his family.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: Almas

texts.ru: Almas 42 goda, u nee dvoe detey I muj. Ona rabotaet uchitelnicoy v detskom sadike. U nee svoy biznes ovcevodstva vot uje 12 let. Ona ix virashivaet I prodayet na mestnom masnom rinke. Almas na budushee planiruet vzat kredit dla rasshireniya biznesa. Segodna ona obratilas za 1500 AZN manat dla togo chtobi sdelat remont doma. Ona kupit stroymateriali.
texts.en: Almas is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She works as a teacher at a kindergarten.  She has also had her own business of sheep keeping for 12 years.  She raises and then sells them at the local meat market.  Almas plans to request a future loan to expand her business.  Today, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to make repairs at home.  She will purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for housing repairs

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu. She is married to George. They have one child, who is two years old.

Loice started her tailoring business one year ago due to the strain in the economy. She needed to boost her business, so she decided to join KADET LTD. She has taken out her first loan of KES 20,000. She plans to use the anticipated profits for expanding her business.

Her dream is to open more branches and provide the best lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy more yards of materials for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Elizabeth, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de la imprenta, ella realiza trabajos de impresión como publicidad. Elizabeth invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar suministros y materiales de imprenta, que le permitirá cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes.
Elizabeth está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our partner is Elizabeth. She's a member of the "Cusco Sur" communal bank of the town of Cusco, Peru. The member still runs her printing business. She does printing work for publicity and such. Elizabeth will use the requested loan to purchase supplies and printing materials, which will help her to meet her customers' orders.
Elizabeth is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to improve her family's living conditions, and for helping her expand and bolster her business.
The member gives thanks for the loan and pledges to comply with her repayments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and supplies for her printing business.

loans.name: Florabel

texts.es: Florabel es socia del Bancomunal Milenio y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos (una nena y un varoncito). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa. En este tiempo Florabel ha aprendido a ser muy puntual. Ella dice que FINCA Perú les ayuda bastante. Su sueño para el futuro es de seguir trabajando par que pueda progresar al lado de sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa para vender.
texts.en: Florabel belongs to the “Milenio” (Millennium) communal bank.  She’s 31-years-old, has a spouse and is the mother of two children (a little girl and a little boy).  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 5 years.  She sells clothes.  In this time Florabel has learned how to be very punctual.  She says that FINCA Perú helps them quite a bit.  Her dream for the future is to continue working so that she can make progress alongside her children.  She will use the requested loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es: Frida es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 62 años de edad y es madre de 8 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 9 años y se dedica a la compra de tara y cochinilla, también vende verduras. Ella está agradecida con la institución  por todo el apoyo que le brindan, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque las capacitaciones que recibe le enseñan a ahorrar, a invertir bien su dinero y mejorar como persona, ella dice que al asistir a parte que aprende mucho también le permite distraerse y compartir experiencias con sus demás compañeras. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tara.
texts.en:
Frida’s a member of the “Sonrisa” (Smile) communal bank.  She’s 62-years-old and the mother of 8 children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 9 years and she is a tara [small leguminous tree or thorny shrub native to Peru] and cochineal merchant; she also sells vegetables.  

She’s grateful to the institution for all the support they provide her.  She enjoys attending her communal bank meetings because the training she gets teaches her how to save, to invest her money well and to improve as a person.  She says that by attending besides learning much she also enjoys herself sharing experiences with her fellow members.  The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy tara.

loans.use: to buy a plant called "tara" [Caesalpinia spinosa]

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married with two children. She is 27 years old and lives in Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marilyn owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 2,700 to purchase farm chemicals. Marilyn has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. She dreams of a business expansion someday.

loans.use: To purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 25 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines.

Reynante provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for his motorcycle's gasoline.

Reynante has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Reynante hopes to improve his services for his incoming child.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for his motorcycle's gasoline

loans.name: Erika Yovany

texts.es:
Erika tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de su abuelo, quién la ha educado desde pequeña. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Monteverde Bajo Lote 92 Dist Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

A pesar de su corta edad, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y trabjadora. Por un lado, Erika se dedica ala venta de golosinas y gaseosas, en propio domicilio, en el cual atiende permanentemente y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), las cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal las comercializa en el mercado local. Presenta un 1 año de experiencia en dichos negocios. Dada la buena clientela y los buenos prospectos de su tienda Erika busca sacar un prestamo de 800 soles con Edpyme Alternativa, con la ayuda de Kiva para comprar mas mercacia, ofrecer una gama mas variada de productos y seguir ampliando su negocio. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Erika, 19, is single and has no children.  She lives with her grandfather, who raised her from a young age, in his house, which is located in the hamlet of Monteverde Bajo, Lot 92, district of Tambogrande.  She lives in the rural area of the district but has electricity.

Despite her young age, she is a very enterprising and hardworking person.  On the one hand, Erika works selling candy and soda in her own home, where she serves at all hours and has regular customers.  She also raises poultry (chickens and turkeys), which she sells in her local market when they reach the ideal weight and size.  She has one year of experience in these businesses.

Given her steady customers and good prospects for her store, Erika is looking to get a loan for 800 soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa, with help from Kiva, to buy more merchandise, offer a greater variety of products, and continue expanding her business.

She has the support of her family and a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.es: Teresa es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 54 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 5 años  y es dueña de una tienda de artesanías donde le va muy bien. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal y está agradecida por lo que le brindan conocimientos para mejorar en su negocio, en su familia, así como en lo personal, gracias a ello hoy sabe ahorrar e invertir bien en su negocio. Ella dice que en otras entidades no brindan estas capacitaciones. El préstamo  que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de chompas, retablos y toros de cerámica para aumentar la variedad de productos en su negocio y surtirlo.
texts.en:
Teresa’s a member of the “Sonrisa” (Smile) communal bank.  She’s 54-years-old and the mother of four children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for more than five years and she owns a crafts store where she does very well.  

She very much enjoys the training she gets in her communal bank and is grateful because they provide knowledge she can use to improve her business, her family as well as personally.  Thanks to it she now knows how to save and invest well in her business.  She says that other entities do no offer such training.  She will use the requested loan to buy sweaters, wood altar pieces and ceramic bulls to increase the variety of products she has in her store and to stock it.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, religious wood carvings and ceramic bulls.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 45 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella pudo ahorrar su dinero y asiste a las reuniones de su Bancomunal donde recibe capacitaciones que le ayudan a mejorar en la atención de sus clientes y también en lo personal, también le gusta mucho las facilidades de préstamos que le brindan, ella dice que es un ayuda las mujeres que quieren progresar y llevar por el buen camino a su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y así poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Juana’s a member of the “Sonrisa” (Smile) communal bank.  She’s 45-years-old and has three children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for a year.  She sells clothes in the market.  In her time as a member of FINCA Perú she’s been able to save money and she attends her communal bank meeting where she gets training that helps her improve customer service and also helps her personally.  She likes the easy loan terms very much and says that it’s a great help for women who want to make progress and lead their families along a righteous path.  She will use the requested loan to buy clothes to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Violeta, tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera de 5 hijos varones. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y es dueña de una ferretería. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú la lección que más ha aprendido es a ahorrar. Ella dice que esta agradecida con la institución por todo el apoyo que le brinda cuando más lo necesita y de esa manera ella puede trabajar. Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando y poderse comprar un automóvil para ella misma. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su ferretería como clavos, tornillos, pintura, cemento, ladrillos, etc.
texts.en: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Violeta, tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera de 5 hijos varones. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y es dueña de una ferretería. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú la lección que más ha aprendido es a ahorrar. Ella dice que esta agradecida con la institución por todo el apoyo que le brinda cuando más lo necesita y de esa manera ella puede trabajar. Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando y poderse comprar un automóvil para ella misma. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su ferretería como clavos, tornillos, pintura, cemento, ladrillos, etc.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para su ferretería como clavos, tornillos, pintura, cemento, ladrillos

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de helados, venta de queso, producción de chuño, producción de papa, tienda de artículos varios .

La señora Justina, indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la promoción llegada al lugar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de helados, ella cuenta que hace muchos años atrás ella vendía helados en la Ciudad de La Paz y en ese empleo el dueño le enseño a elaborara estos productos y cuando ella volvió a su comunidad emprendió este negocio, con su propio establecimiento.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incrementar la materia prima (compra de esencias) mismo que comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que no es exigente con el tema de garantías.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer” (Dawn) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board that has Justina as its president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: ice-cream making, cheese sales, 'chuño' [dehydrated potato] production, potato production and a variety store.

Justina indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to a promotional campaign in her area.  She currently has a business making and selling ice-cream.  She relates that many years ago she used to sell ice-cream in the city of La Paz and the owner of that business taught her how to make these products so when she returned to her community she started her own business.

The loan she’s requesting now is to increase raw materials.  She’ll buy spices in the street markets in the city of El Alto and once the items are made she’ll sell them in her local street markets.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that Pro Mujer isn’t very demanding with respect to loan collateral.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard runs a transportation business to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya of 30,000 KES, which helped him to buy new tires for his car. He dreams of running a taxi company in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is relisting Sarah Jane's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is 45 years old and has 6 children. She is married, and 5 of her children are in school. Annaly is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Annaly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annaly has been farming rice for 7 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 2 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Annaly would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a "sari-sari" store, a small grocery, in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 17 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and women's purses.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 45 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Emelita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelita has been farming rice for 10 years, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other supplies for raising rice.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 54 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She has run a posho mill business for the past year in Narok area, grinding cereals into flour and earning a monthly income of KES 80,000. 


This is her first loan, for KES 30,000, from KADET LTD.  She intends to purchase additional cereals for her business.


She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plan is to set up a large outlet.

loans.use: to purchase additional cereals for her posho mill business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El señor Diego tiene 31 años, es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Villarrica, el es Técnico en refrigeración, arregla heladeras y hace mantenimientos y carga de oxigeno a Split y aires acondicionados.
Cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su trabajo ya que siempre hace trabajos de buena calidad, que es muy apreciado por sus clientes, gracias a ello ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre vuelve a su negocio por su buen servicio.
Diego se ha acercado a kiva y fundación paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la construcción de su propio taller de reparaciones, con lo cual podrá tener mayores ingresos  y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Diego is 31 years old and unmarried. He lives in the city of Villarrica, where he works as a refrigeration technician. He repairs refrigerators and performs maintenance on air conditioning units. He tells us that his work is going very well because he always does high-quality work, which his clients appreciate. He has a loyal customer base that always returns to his business because of his excellent service. Diego has approached Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan, which he hopes to use to build his own repair workshop. A workshop will allow him to increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: to build a repair workshop.

loans.name: Tinyo Gabriel

texts.en:
Tinyo is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 12.  All of them go to school. 

Tinyo runs a general store, and she has been in business for six years.  She has no employees.  She heard about Finance Sudan through its other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase flour and many other items for her store.   In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Tinyo would like to expand her business and open a depot.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Tinyo says she is grateful for the loans given by Finance Sudan .

loans.use: To buy flour and other items for her general store.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
For more than 10 years, Sadullo has had his own business dealing with animal-husbandry. He is very successful and a perfect business man. In the local market, he has many customers. 

Sadullo has a friendly family. His wife helps him with the business. They have two children and try to do the best for them. 

He wants to develop the business, but his income is small. He is asking a loan to buy young cattle to raise so he can develop his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to raise.

loans.name: Lidia Sonia

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Bancomunal Llamkasum y tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 5 hijos (tres mujeres y dos varones). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y es dueña de su propia tienda donde se vende ropa y elabora chompas. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo la lección que más ha aprendido es la importancia del ahorro y la puntualidad. Su sueño para el futuro es ser profesional en la producción de las chompas y eventualmente le encantaría tener una cadena de tiendas donde pueda vender sus productos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa, hilos y telas para vender en su negocio.
texts.en: Lidia is a member of the Llamkasum village bank. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children (three girls and two boys). She has been a member of FINCA Perú for three years and owns a shop where she sells clothing and makes sweaters. She tells us that the biggest lesson she's learned over the years is the importance of saving and punctuality. Her dream is to develop her sweater-making business, and eventually she'd like to have a chain of stores where she can sell her products. She will invest the requested loan in buying more clothing, thread, and fabric to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, thread, and fabric.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Hormigas, tiene 60 años de edad y es madre soltera 1 hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años y es dueña de una farmacia.  Ella dice que dentro de la institución ha recibido mucha ayuda y gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal aprendió a trabajar, a valorarse, a educar a su hijo que ahora ya es profesional. Su sueño para el futuro es ser empresaria y comprar  casas para que las pueda vender, pero sobre todo seguir progresando. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos farmacéuticos como pastillas, jarabes, aplicables, alcohol, gasas, medicamentos en general, etc. para que lo venda en su farmacia.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the Hormigas village bank. She is 60 years old and the single mother of one son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 16 years and owns a pharmacy. She says that FINCA Perú has given her a lot of help, and the support she's gotten from her village bank has taught her to work, to value herself, and to educate her son, who now has a successful career. Her dream is to be a businesswoman and buy houses to then sell them again, but most of all she wants to keep moving forward. She will invest the requested loan in products such as pills, cough syrups, rubbing alcohol, gauze, other medications, and so on to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy products such as pills, cough syrups, rubbing alcohol, gauze, and other medications.

loans.name: Ngirimba

texts.en:
Ngirimba is 47 years old and married, with six children to support.  He is a wheat farmer.  He has been in this business for the past 10 years, with a monthly income of KES 50,000. 


He is servicing his seventh loan of KES 90,000 from KADET.  This will help him in preparation of the farm and to purchase farm inputs.


He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his wheat farm.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 51-year-old resident of Sinian, Baliangao. She provides for her four children’s needs from the little amount of PHP 8,000 she gains monthly from her banana plantation business. 

She has been in business for five years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

However, since 2011 she has been a member of GDMPC. She is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000 from GDMPC Microfinance to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

Merlyn wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of four children with the last thee being of school-going age. She has been in farming for ten years at her rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. Her farm produces cereals, mainly sorghum and maize, which are sold within the local markets.

Margaret has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds, which will help her diversify her farming income sources. She says it will also help her have income throughout the year, unlike her cereals farming, which brings income during seasons when prices are low due to flooding of the market with similar products from many farmers.

Margaret says poor local markets and insufficient rains remain the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is from Maribojoc, Bohol Philippines. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 14, and 22. 

Her husband works as a farmer to support their family, while Saturnina earns a living by being a nipa buyer. Nipa is a kind of leaves that are used as a roof by some households in the Philippines. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more nipa from nipa growers, seedlings, and fertilizer for farming. 

She hopes to make a good profit out of these businesses so she can support her children's needs. Her profit will be for school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa (leaves used for roofing) from nipa growers, seedlings, and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
This is Almira. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of onions and garlic. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Almira hopes to expand her store and help her children through all of her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of products needed in her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a married woman with 4 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Tessie owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns PHP 8,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Tessie became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2010. She dreams of business expansion someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Tabu Mathew

texts.en:
Tabu is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 5 and 15. Four of them go to school. 

Tabu runs a general store and has been in business for 4 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by its officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase flour and many other items. In addition to this business, Tabu has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Tabu would like to expand his business and open a depot. Her major challenges include high prices of transportation.

Tabu says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy items like flour

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Isatu from Aberdeen in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with one child who is three years old.

Isatu runs a general merchandise business. She sells cigarettes, soap, milk, sugar, and soft drinks. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business 30 days per month and 12 hours a day. Her business is the only source of income she has. Her husband is a civil servant worker but his income is not enough to support their family. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more general foodstuffs like soft drinks, mayonnaise, milk, sugar and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to build a house and open another shop. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Isatu  from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more items like soft drinks, mayonnaise, milk, sugar, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана использовала предыдущий кредит на завершение постройки и оборудования своего торгового киоска. Теперь у нее есть возможность продавать больше товара и обслуживать больше покупателей. Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10,000 гривен для закупки фруктов и овощей. Лето - пик продаж в бизнесе Оксаны и она надеется, что кредит поможет ей увеличить оборот и получить дополнительную прибыль.

Оксане по-прежнему помогает вся семья и ее бизнес можно вполне назвать семейным.
texts.en:
Oksana has used the previous loan to complete the construction and equipment of her vendor stand. Now she has the ability to sell more products and service more customers. Oksana is asking to provide her with a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to buy fruits and vegetables. Summer is a peak season of sales in Oksana's business and she hopes that the loan will help her increase the sales volume and received additional profit.

Oksana's family is still helping her and her business can be perfectly called a family business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила вдова. У нее четверо детей. Людмила имеет собственный бизнес.

На центральном рынке  города Людмила торгует женской трикотажной одеждой. Она работает в этом направлении 17 лет. Людмила знает на какой товар есть спрос. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная. 

Людмила имеет желание развивать бизнес, чтобы улучшить условия проживания ее семьи. Она просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара - футболок, блуз, лекгих брюи, пр.
texts.en:
Ludmila is a widow. She has four children. Ludmila has her own business. 

She sells women's knitted clothing on the central market of her town. She has been working in this field for seventeen years. Ludmila knows which merchandise is in demand. She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

Ludmila has the desire to grow her business so she can improve the living conditions for her family. She is asking to provide her with a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal merchandise: t-shirts, blouses, light pants and other goods.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, light pants and other seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Aminata from Waterloo in the eastern part of Freetown. She is widowed with seven children between the ages of 18 years and 22 years old. Two of her children attend school. 

Aminata runs a local foodstuffs business within a busy market area. She sells groundnuts, beans, palm oil and bulgur. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business every day expect on Friday because she has to go for prayer. Her other source of income comes from a small-scale farm in the village. She describes her biggest business challenge as ripe inflation and the poor road network.  

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs such as groundnuts, beans and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open another store. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Aminata from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs such as groundnuts, beans and palm oil

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Aminata from Waterloo in the eastern part of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 1978, Aminata established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to sustain her family. She works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 7 days per week.  At present, she is facing transportation problems. 

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more rice, Maggi, onions, and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Aminata plans to be a supplier to her business partner. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Aminata from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more rice, Maggi, onions, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian. She previously accessed a loan of 14,000 PHP that she used to buy computer spare parts and accessories needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Vivian would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to have additional capital for her business and to buy spare parts and accessories for computers. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vivian hopes to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Abdul from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with five children between the ages of five and 22 years old. One of his children is currently attending school. In 2002, Abdul established his business. He began his business because after the death of his father, he had no one to take care of his schooling. He operates his business early in the morning until night, every day. He says price inflation is the main problem they are facing.

Abdul requires a loan in order to buy flasks, bowls, glasses, cups and buckets. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and renovate the roof of his shop since it is the rainy season. In the future, Abdul plans to build more shops and become a distributor. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Abdul from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy flasks, bowls, glasses, cups and buckets.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hassan from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of five and 15 years old. He has two children who are currently attending school.   

Hassan runs a local foodstuffs business, He sells palm oil, (grain cassava), groundnuts and pepper. He has been running this business for 15 years. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm, seven days per week. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation because to transport the goods from the village to Waterloo is not easy.

Hassan has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, grain cassava, groundnuts and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow him to start a savings account and send his children to school. In the future, he plans to export palm oil overseas. He appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Hassan from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To  buy more palm oil, grain cassava, groundnuts and pepper.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Elizabeth is single and she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old and married. He supports a family of six children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He is requesting his seventh loan of KES 90,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of farm inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest  His future dreams is to improve his famiiy's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim, 52, is from a rural village located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is married with five children and she still only has one daughter to take care of. Her daughter works in the family's business. She and her husband earn a living through planting cashew nuts on 1.5 hectare of farmland. They supplement their income through planting coconut trees, lemon trees, mango trees and jackfruit trees and selling the crops for income. She and her husband have been in this business for four years. To better feed her family, she and her husband also farm rice, which they have been doing this year. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day.

This is Khim’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a first-time borrower. The other group member has been with VisionFund for one year. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for plowing the land. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to set aside some money to fulfill her dream of having a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy balanced feed for his small livestock.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio de la costureria, invirtiendo en telas de diferentes colores y estilos, hilo, broches, ciper, y otros materiales de costura como bronca, que son necesarios para confeccionar vestidos, faldas y trajes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró el mejoramiento en el negocio, ha salido con todos sus pedidos de la sastrería, considera que esto le ha permitido mantenerse en su trabajo y tener esta fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan, in order to invest in her sewing business, buying fabric of various colors and styles, thread, clasps, zippers and other sewing materials necessary for the making of dresses, skirts and suits.

With the previous loan, she managed to improve her business and finish all her tailoring orders. She considers that this has allowed her keep her business going and have this source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric of various colors and styles, thread, clasps and zippers.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y cuenta con dos hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia junto a su familia.  La zona en donde reside es una de las zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mochumi, una zona netamente agrícola, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de cincuenta familias.

La actividad que desarrolla es la comercialización de animales, contando con una gran cantidad de aves de corral de gran demanda en la zona, como son patos, pavos. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace seis años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección el negocio, las tecnicas para el engorde del ave en corto plazo y lugares de gran demanda para su venta, tanto sacrificado como vivo. Los ingresos de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Gregoria desea adquirir materiales como tejas y adobe para terminar la construccion de su domicilio, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante abnegada y que da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Gregoria agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 22 years old, is married and has two children who depend on her and lives in her own home with her family. The area where she lives is one of the rural areas that make up the district of Mochumi, a purely agricultural area, it is a small community made up of about fifty families.

Gregoria works selling animals and has a great quantity of fowl that are in high demand in the area like ducks and turkeys. She has worked in this field for some six years as her business is in her home. She learned her trade from her mother and knows every aspect of her business like techniques for fattening the birds quickly and places where they are in high demand both dead and alive. The income from Gregoria’s work is used to help her husband care for their family.

Gregoria wishes to buy materials like roof tile and adobe to finish construction in their home, this is why she has gone to Edpyme Alternative for the first time for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles that will help her meet her objective.

Gregoria is a very unselfish woman that always gives the best of herself to help her family get ahead in life. She is thankful to those who will help her see her goal come true.

loans.use: buy materials like roof tile and adobe to finish construction of her home.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es socia del Bancomunal El Roble y tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 2 hijos varones. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes. La lección que Adela ha aprendido más durante todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú es a ser puntual y asistir a todas las reuniones de su Bancomunal. Su sueño para el futuro es tener propiedades que pueda alquilar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas y abarrotes para vender en su bodega como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, refrescos, gaseosas.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank.  She is 39 years old, married and the mother of two sons.  She became a member of FINCA Perú two years ago and she has a small store where she sells groceries.  The lesson that Adela has learned most during her time as a member of  FINCA Perú is to be punctual and to attend all the meetings of her Communal Bank.  Her dream for the future is to have properties that she can rent.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of beverages and groceries to sell in her small store like rice, sugar, oil, milk, juices, and sodas.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Beatriz Regina

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en casa de sus padres con su pequeño bebé de 3 meses de nacido, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde ahora ella será padre y madre para su pequeño; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos Beatriz no ha podido cursar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, día a día Beatriz trabaja como empleada del hogar en una vivienda cercana a la suya, ella labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que la consideran mucho por su buena labor y por su trato amable.
Beatriz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un carrito sanguchero, el cual le servirá para vender frituras, tales como: salchipapas, pollo broaster, hamburguesas, entre otros; de esta manera Beatriz espera poder conseguir mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para cubrir los gastos para el cuidado y bienestar de su bebé, así poco a poco ella espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y lograr ver realizado a su pequeño.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 22 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica in her parents’ home with her 3 month old baby. Sadly for different reasons she separated from her partner and will be father and mother to her little one. Beatriz is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who gives her all to see that her baby will get ahead in life. Her need to work and paying her expenses have not permitted Beatriz to have a career or study a profession but in the future would like to study computer engineering. In her free time, Beatriz enjoys relaxing by listening to some music and cooking delicious rice with chicken for her family.

With a lot of hard work, Beatriz works daily as a housekeeper in a nearby home, she works about 8 hours a day and feels comfortable in her job since she is well liked for her good job and kindness.

Beatriz is very grateful with the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help given she will be able to buy a small cart that will help her sell fried food like: hotdogs and potatoes, roasted chicken, hamburgers, and other items. Beatriz hopes to be able to have more income that she will use to meet her baby’s expenses as well its wellbeing, little by little she hopes to see her greatest dream come true, and having her own home and seeing her little one become a professional.

loans.use: buy a food cart.

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.es: Reynilda es socia del Bancomunal Imperio y tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y es dueña de una ferretería. Ella dice que gracias a los prestamos que le brindaron crecer ella pudo crecer en su negocio así como en lo personal, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque aprende mucho con las capacitaciones que allí recibe, dice que son de gran ayuda para mejorar como persona y también para crecer en el negocio, aprendió a ahorrar, a distribuir sus ganancias y también a  invertir bien en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su ferretería como tubos, clavos, pintura, tornillos, cemento, fierros, etc.
texts.en: Reynilda is a member of the Imperio Community Bank.  She is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She became a member of FINCA Perú eight years ago and is the owner of a hardware store.  She says that thanks to the loans she has been offered, she was able to grow in her business as well as in her personal life.  She enjoys attending Community Bank meetings because she learns a lot with the trainings she receives.  She says they are a great help in improving herself as a person and also in expanding her business.  She learned how to save, distribute her earnings, and also to invest well in her business.  The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her hardware store such as tubes, nails, paint, screws, cement, iron, etc.

loans.use: to purchase tubes, nails, paint, screws, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Nohemi Elizabeth

texts.es:
NOHEMI ELIZABETH,TRABAJA EN UNA CONSTRUCTORA Y SE DESEMPEÑA COMO ARQUITECTA
ELLA CUENTA CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES LLAMADA LA SRITA; NIOHEMI,ATENDIDA POR SU MAMA
NOHEMI TRABAJA DIA A DIA PARA SACAR EL GASTO DE LA TIENDA Y DE SU CASA
PARA ASI PODER CONTRIBUIR A LOS GASTOS GENERALES DE LA CASA
ASI AYUDAR A SU MAMA ECONOMICAMENTE
NOHEMI  TIENE EL DESEO DE ADQUIRIR MAS MERCANCIA,Y ASI OBTENER MAS CLIENTES
GENERANDO ASI MAS INGRESOS A SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
Nohemi Elizabeth works in construction and is studying to be an architect. She has a small grocery store called “La Señorita”. Her mother works there. Nohemi works each day to support the store and her house. This is how she can contribute to the household expenses and help her mother financially.
Nohemi would like to buy more merchandise for the store and in this way get more customers. This will generate more income for her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda es socia del Bancomunal Imperio y tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 9 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 10 años y es dueña de una tienda donde vende artesanías. Está orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado y de pertenecer a FINCA Perú porque allí aprendió a ahorrar y a progresar al lado de su familia y también en su negocio. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque cada vez lleva un gran mensaje a su hogar y lo comparte con sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas que trae de otro país para venderlas y también con ellas elabora faldas y justanes que vende como parte de sus artesanías .
texts.en: Florinda is a member of the Imperial Community Bank. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of nine children. She has been a member FINCA Perú for the past ten years. She is the owner of a store that sells folk-art. She is proud of all that she has accomplished as a member of FINCA Perú because she has learned how to save money and progress with her family and also in her business. She likes to attend the community bank meetings as each time she goes she brings back home information that she shares with her children. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy fabric that she will bring to other countries to sell and also she will use it to make plain and tiered skirts to sell as part of her folk-art offerings.

loans.use: to buy fabric and folk-art.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es socia del Bancomunal Urubamba, tiene 50 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos. Ella es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 7 años y se dedica a la venta de chicharrón, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Ella dice que gracias a los préstamos que le brindaron logró abrir su tienda donde ahora vende abarrotes, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque le enseñaron la puntualidad y el ahorro, también la administración de sus ganancias y como invertir en su negocio,  todo eso lo aprendió gracias a las capacitaciones, dice que su promotora es bien amena y confiable. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne  para la elaboración de los chicharrones y otra parte en mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes como azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, bebidas, etc.
texts.en: Delia is a member of the Urubamba Communal Bank; she is 50 years old and is a mother to 4. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 7 years and sells fried crackling and has a small grocery store. She says that thanks to the loans she was able to open her own store where she now sells groceries. Delia enjoys going to her Communal Bank’s meetings because they teach her about being punctual and about savings as well as managing her earnings and how to invest in her business. She has learned all of this thanks to the training provided and says that her sponsor is kind and trustworthy. The loan that she wants will be used to buy meat to make fried crackling and merchandize for her small grocery store like sugar, rice, milk, spaghetti, refreshments, etc.

loans.use: buy meat to make fried crackling and merchandize for her small grocery store like sugar, rice, milk, spaghetti, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 49 years old and married with two children.

Verginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell to customers.

Verginia has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Verginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita es socia del Bancomunal Imperio y tiene 56 años de edad, es vuida y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y de una tienda donde vende motores. En el tiempo que lleva como socia de FINCA Perú ella está aprendiendo a ahorrar e invertir de manera adecuada en su negocio y las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseña muchas cosas que le sirven en su vida diaria y en su negocio, y lo más importante es que las pone en práctica en su hogar donde les explica a sus hijos las enseñanzas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para motores para su negocio.
texts.en: Felicita is a member of "Bancomunal Imperio" (Empire Communal Bank).  She is 56 years old, a widow and the mother of 5 children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 1 year and has a store where she sells motors.  In the time that she has been a member of FINCA Perú, she has learned to save and to invest in her business appropriately.  The trainings from her communal bank have taught her a lot and served her in both her business and her daily life.  Most importantly, she puts what she has learned into practice in her home, where she explains the teachings to her children.  Felicita will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts for motors, for her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motors.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes, tiene 40 años, se dedica a realizar servicios de manicura, además de eso también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y prendas de todo tipo.
Mercedes es conocida en su barrio por su buen trabajo y su amabilidad con las personas. Se dedica a este trabajo dese hace 10 años, brindando a sus clientes un excelente servicio.
El crédito lo solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de ropas y cosméticos para la venta, lo cual le ayudará a seguir trabajando y ganando ingresos para su familia. La señora agradece la ayuda, pues le permite crecer en su emprendimiento como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old and works as a manicurist as well as selling cosmetics and all types of accessories.  

Mercedes is known in her neighborhood for her good work and her friendliness with people.  She has worked at this job for 10 years, offering her clients excellent service.

The loan she is requesting from the Fundación Paraguaya is for the purchase of accessories and cosmetics to sell, which will help her to continue working and earning income for her family.  She is grateful for the help, because it allows her to grow in her undertaking as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia hace platos como arroz con pollo,pollo al horno y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues to work in the restaurant business. She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She makes dish such as chicken and rice, baked chicken and fried bread. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. This business helps her children succeed. Her dream is to grow and improve her restaurant business. She is asking for this loan to buy cooking products such as chicken, meat and vegetables.This member is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es: Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza donde tiene el cargo de presidenta de la Junta Directiva. Es casada, tiene 68 años de edad y es madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años, es profesora de profesión y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propia tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es que le enseñaron a ahorrar y dice que las capacitaciones son muy buenas ya que pone en práctica los mensajes que le transmiten en dichas charlas. Está agradecida con la institución por todas las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, bebidas.
texts.en: Eudomilia is a member of “A Grain of Mustard” Community Bank. She is the president of the local group. She is married, 67 years old and the mother of seven children. For the past four years she has been a member of FINCA Peru. She is a teacher and also sells groceries from her own store. What she likes the best about the community bank is that they taught her how to save money and their training is very good as they give practical information in their meetings. She is thankful to this institution for the loans that it offers. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour and drinks.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour and drinks.

loans.name: Tolmas

texts.en: Tolmas always tries to do the best for his family. He is a very caring father of 3 children and a lovely husband. Also he is successful businessman. He has owned an agriculture business for more than 8 years. Tolmas grows wheat, corn, and vegetables. He has additional income from animal husbandry. His wife helps him with the business. They want to develop the business further and that’s why they work hard. Their house is in bad condition and they must repair it. Tolmas is asking for a loan to buy building materials. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz y tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años y es dueña de su propia tienda donde se vende abarrotes. Ella dice que gracias a FINCA Perú ha podido construir su casa, ha crecido su negocio y ha podido comprarse sus cositas para su hogar. En todo este tiempo ha aprendido mucho a brindar una buena atención a sus clientes y también al buen trato a sus hijos, a forjarles que tengan una buena educación. Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su tienda y aumentarlo para incluir una ferretería y la venta de ropa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, harina, fideos, bebidas.
texts.en: Viviana is a member of “The Peace Community Bank”. She is 42 years old and is married. For the past six years he has been a member of FINCA Peru. She is the owner of her own store where she sells groceries. Thanks to FINCA Peru she has been able to build a house, grow her business and buy things for her house. In this time she has learned a lot such as how to serve her customers and also how to raise her children and give them a good education. Her dreams for the future are to improve her store and increase her business by adding hardware and clothing sections. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, noodles and drinks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, noodles and drinks.

loans.name: Cervando

texts.es:
el señor servando trabaja para una empresa como mensajero y en sus tiempo libres se dedica a la venta de colchas y subrecamas suledos con los cuales ha podido solventar los gastos familiares; su esposa se dideca a las labores del hogar.
el señor servando desea poder pagar los utiles escolares de sus hijos
para forjarles un buen futuro i asi darles una buena educacion
y sacarlos adelante.  
uno de los muchos beneficios a largo plazo es que sus hijos se esforzaran en estudiar mas para agrader el sacrificio que sus padres entan haciendo para conseguir el material a tiempo
texts.en: Cervando works for a company as a courier and in his free time sells bedspreads and comforters, with which he has been able to cover family expenses. His spouse is a housewife. Cervando wishes to buy school supplies for his children to forge a better future for them by giving them a good education. One of the long-term benefits is that his children will study harder to repay their parents for the sacrifices they have made to get them the materials on time.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Gloria, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia trabaja en su restaurante. Gloria invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos etc. para su restaurante.
Gloria está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Gloria belongs to the “Cusco Sur” ("South Cusco") community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She works at a restaurant. Gloria plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles and other items for her restaurant. Gloria feels very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and helping  grow and strengthen her business. Gloria is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es: Leonilda es socia del Bancomunal El Roble y tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 9 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace mas de 14 años y es dueña de su propia tienda donde se vende ropa hecha de lana. Ella dice que durante todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú lo que mas ha aprendido es la importancia de ahorrar y de ser puntual. Ella comenta que cuando tiene un apuro o un problema económico ella puede vivir de sus ahorros acumulados y de esta manera tiene estabilidad en su vida. Leonilda dice que está viviendo sus sueños realizados y agradece a la institución ya que ahora ella tiene su casa propia y todos sus hijos son profesionales.
