El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de varios hilos, telas, y lana para su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the "El Roble" communal bank. She is 64, married, and the mother of nine children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 14 years and owns her own store where wool clothing is sold. 

She says that during all this time as a member of Finca Perú, what she has learned the most is the importance of saving and being on time with payments. She says that when she is in a tight spot, or has a financial problem, she can live on her accumulated savings and this way have stability in her life.  

Leonilda says that she is seeing her dreams come true, and is grateful to the institution, as now she has her own house and all her children are professionals. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of various kinds of thread, fabric and wool for her business.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of thread, fabric and wool.

loans.name: Benigno Julio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de el mantenimiento y reparacion de de computadoras,el socio repara computadoras y teclados,el tiene un taller donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de mantenimiento y reparacion de computadoras.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos como cables y herramientas para que arregle las computadoras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julio continues to dedicate himself to his business maintaining and repairing computers and keyboards. He has a shop where he works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m., and the business has helped him make headway for his children. Julio's dream is to expand his business, and he is requesting a loan to purchase parts like cables and tools to fix computers. He feels happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cables and tools to fix computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandize like candies, groceries and refreshments to stock his store.

loans.name: Dennys Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de distribucion de comestibles como papitas que son snacks,el socio reparte a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes,el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño trabajo el socio saca adelante a su familia ya que es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar papitas al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to be in the foodstuff distribution business like potato chip snacks. The member distributes the items to different grocery stores and works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Through his small business he is able to get his family ahead since he is a hardworking and enterprising person. His dream is to have a small grocery store. The member needs the loan to buy potato chips wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan and is committed of meeting all of his payment quotas.

loans.use: buy potato chips wholesale.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Milton, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de accesorios y suministros de computo, como tintes, hardware y software, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería e implementar su actividad.
Milton está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Milton belongs to the village bank "Cusco Sur" in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues his business buying and selling computer supplies and accessories like ink, hardware and software. He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of merchandise so he can do his work.

Milton is very grateful to Kiva for letting him continue his work and support his family. He is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy computing accessories and supplies.

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.en: Nurulo is the best master of making cradles and boxes. He is jolly, kind, and cute. He has been engaged in this business for more than 11 years. Nurulo makes baby cradles and boxes for storing things and sells them to the local people. He makes them wonderful and that’s why he has many customers. He has four smart children and a lovely wife. His older son helps him with the business. He wants to develop the business further but his income isn't enough for it. He wants to buy wood for making more cradles and boxes. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wood for making cradles and boxes

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: El Sr. Segundo tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos que sonde las edades de  16; 9 y 7 años, el es agricultor, siembra maíz, yuca y variedad de vegetales en su parcela  que se encuentran en la localidad de Tunalito "Rio Seco" este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Segundo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, El Sr. Segundo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su producción la Sr. Segundo vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Segundo, 48, has three children ages 16, 9 and 7. He is a farmer and plants corn, yucca and a variety of vegetables on his land in Rio Seco, Tunalito. This is his second loan with the institution. He will use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and prepare the land for planting. Segundo faces challenges in his work like improving his quality of life, and he will use the profits to improve his production. Segundo sells his products in the market in town, directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Manuelito

texts.en:
Manuelito is married and has 4 children. He is 45 years old and resides at Calaran, Calamba, Philippines.

Manuelito cultivates fruit trees such as durian (Asian fruit) to earn a living and has been in this business for 8 years. Each month, he earns 10,000 doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Manuelito joined GDMPC. In the future, Manuelito wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is aged 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two sons in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer of 3 hectares of farmland which she has been doing for five years. She also runs a small grocery store while her husband runs a battery charging business and raises pigs. The current business earns her family about 18,700KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 8,700KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Sreymom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 3,000,000KHR, she is going to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her store and use a portion of it to buy piglets for her family’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Belinda Beatriz

texts.es: Belinda de 39 años de edad, vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con sus dos hijos de 11 años y 10 meses de edad. Oriunda de Riohacha, ciudad ubicada en el departamento de la Guajira,  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 5 años, impulsada por su padre a que se dedicara a la actividad comercial, con el fin de generar ingresos para lograr el sostenimiento de su hogar. Así fue como este le regaló una plancha, un secador y una cafetera, avaluada en ese momento en $200.000 COP para que consiguiera compradores  y potencializara el mercado de clientes con estas necesidades, logrando sus pedidos, movilizando este capital y reinvirtiendo. Su primera etapa en la aventura de negocio fue muy difícil, pero poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y lograr construir una clientela fija, que hoy hace  mucho peso en su cartera de créditos y ella debe esperar a recuperarla, para reunir un capital de trabajo suficiente para poder comprar y complacerlos efectivamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará equipos de sonidos, planchas, cámaras digitales, los cuales han solicitado y por eso su inversión tendrá éxito porque sus ventas estarán aseguradas. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda, pues quiere que en la medida que pasa el tiempo sus hijos se sientan mas confortables y seguros en su propia casa. Mientras esto ocurre trabaja permanetemente en su negocio para lograr su sueño de prosperidad, con unos indicadores actuales no inferiores al 19%, desde el cual proyectamos su inversión.
texts.en: Belinda is 39 years old and lives in the southwestern part of the city with her two children, ages 11 and 10 months. A native of Riohaca, a city located in the department of Guajira, Belinda came to Barranquilla five years ago on the advice of her father to make a living in commerce and generate income to provide for her family. He gave her an iron, a hairdryer and a coffee maker, valued around $200 COP, so that she could find buyers and learn the market. With these items, she received orders and reinvested the capital. This first venture in business was very difficult, but little by little with a lot of hard work she was able to increase her sales and build a fixed clientele, which today carries a lot of weight on her loan portfolio. She hopes to sustain it in order to have the working capital needed to make purchases and keep her customers happy. It's for this reason she is requesting a loan, her first from Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she plans to use to purchase sound equipment, irons and digital cameras, which are in demand, so she knows she will have success because her sales are assured. Her goal in the future is to improve the living conditions of her home, so as time passes her children will become more comfortable and secure in their own home. As this occurs she will continue working in her business to be able to achieve her dream of prosperity, with current indicators projecting a 19-percent gain on her investment.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment, irons and digital cameras.

loans.name: Carminia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Carminia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia suge con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. Carminia invertirá el préstamo solicitado para arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, bebidas etc. para su tienda de abarrotes.
Carminia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Carminia belongs to the "Cusco Sur" ("South Cusco") community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues with her grocery store business. She plans to invest in the loan in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, etc., to stock her store. Carminia feels very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and growing and strengthening her business. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Delfin Leopoldo

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio publico,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su carro como llantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Delfin makes a living in the transportation business. He has a car that he drives for the public between 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. He wants to make headway with this business, and his dream is to expand it. He is requesting the loan to purchase parts for his car, such as tires. Delfin is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his car, like tires.

loans.name: Wilfredo Francisco

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un hombre de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa y sus hijos, él es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres terminar sus estudios de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia. 
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a sus ganas de salir adelante, Wilfredo se dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con un pequeño terreno en el cual cultiva frejoles, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria, él se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo.
Wilfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo; de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano, espera poder comprar ganado para iniciar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 51, and lives in the city of Camaná with his wife and children. He is a very friendly person, enthusiatic and hard-working. He devotes all his efforts to helping his family get ahead in life. Unfortunately, because of lack of financial resources, and the need to work to support his parents he didn't finish high school, but he would have very much liked to have done so.  

In his free time he likes to watch educational programs and newscasts on television. Occasionally he cooks a very delicious "arroz chaufa' (Chinese fried rice, prepared Peruvian-style) to share with his family.  

Thanks to his enterprising spirit and his desire to succeed, Wilfredo farms. He has a small piece of land where he grows beans. He devotes approximately 12 hours daily to his business. He is very comfortable in his business, as he has always liked farm work a great deal. 

Wilfredo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support offered, he will be able to undertake the purchase of manure and fertilizers, and will be able to maintain his crop. This way he will be able to ensure the harvest of his crop and increase his income. 

In the not-too-distant future he hopes to be able to buy cattle, in order to start another business.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Braulio Luis

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Braulio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose a su trabajo en una institución del estado, pero ahora también ha incursionado en el negocio de la compra y venta de artesanias, como tejidos y accesorios decorativos, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería e implementar su nueva actividad comercial y artesanal.
Braulio está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y crecer en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Mr. Braulio; he belongs to the “South Cusco” Communal Bank of Cusco Perú. Our member is still working in a state institution but he has now started a business buying and selling artisanal goods like weavings and decorations. The loan will be used to buy merchandize and to start his new business selling artisanal goods.

Braulio is very thankful to Kiva for helping him keep and grow his business and for supporting him along with his family.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to meet all of his payment quotas.

loans.use: buy artisanal goods like weavings and decorations to sell.

loans.name: Richard Ladu

texts.en:
Richard is a 25-year-old  businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of one and four. Neither of them goes to school. 
Richard runs a general store and has been in business for five years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase sandals and many other items. He has no other source of income.
In five years, Richard would like to expand his business.
His major challenge includes high prices in transportation.
Richard says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: for buying more items like shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
This is Felimon. He previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan that he utilized to buy the ingredients he needs in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 
He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in his business. His profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 
Felimon hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients he needs in his business.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el uso de accesorios electrónicos, como por ejemplo en controles de televisión, extensiones eléctricas, focos, regletas eléctricas, que son las necesarias entre otros productos más que sean eléctricos ya que mantiene una buena demanda en el negocio.

Con el préstamo anterior mejoró su capacidad para la aplicación de más calidad en producto electrónico, ha tenido algunos inconvenientes familiares como la enfermedad de uno de sus hijos, esto le ocasionó algunos problemas en su liquidez pero por el momento está comenzando a superarlo y ha iniciado una nueva inyección de productos al negocio para poder estabilizarse.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in electronics accessories such as television remote controls, extension cords, light bulbs, and power strips. These items along with other products are needed to operate electronic appliances and will help him maintain the high demand in his business.

His previous loan improved his ability to supply more electronic products that are of higher quality. Jose encountered a few family difficulties, such as the illness of one of his children. As a result, he has had to deal with a few challenges with his liquidity but now he is starting to overcome those obstacles. With a new inventory of products, his business should become stable.

loans.use: to buy television remote controls, extension cords, light bulbs, and power strips.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es:
Dayana actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a  la venta de edredones y frazadas de forma ambulante por más de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
Ella estudio solo hasta la secundaria y es madre soltera tiene un hijo pequeño y vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más frazadas para poder venderlas y obtener más ingresos para mantener a su hijo.
El sueño de Dayana, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Dayana currently generates income by selling quilts and blankets as a street vendor. She works more than 10 hours a day in order to pay for food and basic services for her family.

Dayana only has a high school education and is a single mother of a small child. She lives at her parents’ house where she occupies one room. Their home is located in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more blankets to sell so that she can generate more income to support her child. Dayana’s dreams are to improve her income, become independent, and be more comfortable.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Miguel Angel, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose al servicio de Taxi, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para hacerle un mantenimiento integral a su vehículo y comprarle algunos repuestos.
Miguel Angel está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is Sr. Miguel Angel. He belongs to the Communal Bank “Cusco Sur” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. Miguel continues to provide taxi services. For this reason, he will invest the loan he requested in necessary maintenance of his vehicle and also in the purchase of a few spare parts.

Miguel Angel is extremely grateful to Kiva for enabling him to maintain his business and support his family. He is appreciates the loan and promises to complete his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for renovations, an air conditioner, cloths, material, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Lorena hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes  is a married woman. She has a daughter who is four years old. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a tailoring store where she sell clothes such as suits and provides repair to her customers' worn out clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a busy shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have had expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 29 years old and married with two children.
Joann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.
Joann has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.
Joann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rene Paul

texts.es: A René le ha gustado desde los 10 años trabajar por lo que empezó su propio negocio vendiendo bolos recorriendo los sectores de su tierra natal Portoviejo. Empezó con poco inventario y poco a poco ha ido creciendo por el aumento de clientes, los recorridos los realiza de lunes a viernes todo el día. Para René la época más baja del año es el invierno ya que el clima no ayuda en la venta de su mercadería, también las vacaciones escolares porque ese es uno de sus mejores mercados. Los bolos los vende por unidad a un costo de $ 0.15 ctv., y por paquete a $ 1.80. El vive en feliz unión con Maria Isabel quien realiza trabajos para fiestas infantiles en fomix y su hija quien asiste al jardín de infantes. Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara bolos y agua para la venta. Le gustaría a futuro poder tener un negocio más amplio para poder dar empleo y mejorar su economía.
texts.en: René has enjoyed working since he was ten-years-old, and for this reason her has started his own activity selling cakes traveling around the sectors of Portoviejo, his native soil. He started selling a few products, and his inventory has been growing little by little with the increase in the number of customers. He travels around the sectors all day long, Mondays to Fridays. René sells less in winter, as the weather does not help him selling his products, as well as during school holidays, because schools are a great market for him. He charges $ 0.15 for one cake and $ 1.80 for a packet. He is happily married with Maria Isabel, who creates Styrofoam items for children’s parties, and their daughter who foes to kindergarten. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cakes and water to sell. In the future he would like to own and run a bigger shop in order to create jobs and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy cakes and water.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia tiene 29 años, es una mujer alegre y muy laboriosa. Está casada con Mauth, de 32 años, fruto de ello tienen cuatro hijos. Viven en su casa propia, la que compraron gracias a los años de convivencia que llevan.
Desde hace 9 años lleva vendiendo ropa. Para ella es más fácil tener su puesto de venta cerca de su casa, porque le ahorra tiempo para realizar el desayuno y el almuerzo para su familia. Lo bueno de su negocio es que cuenta con una cantidad de clientes que llegan por sí solos, sabiendo que encontraran las prendas adecuadas para sus gustos. El éxito de su negocio radica en el buen trato y ofrecer su mercadería a precios módicos.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y se siente contenta de saber que una vez más contará con un apoyo financiero. Asimismo, en su banco comunal es una socia puntual con sus cuotas de pago y se siente agradecida por trabajar con personas solidarias.  
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar mayor variedad de prendas, así como algunos maniquíes para mostrar la ropa.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 29 years old.  She is a cheerful and very hard-working woman.  She is married to 32-year-old Mauth and the couple have four children.  They live in their own home which they bought thanks to the years they have been living together.

Olimpia has been selling clothing for nine years.  She finds it easier to have her sales location near her home because it saves her time and she is therefore able to make breakfast and lunch for her family.  The good thing about her business is that she has a large number of customers who come to visit her knowing that they will find clothes to suit their tastes.  Her business success lies in the good service she provides and the fact that she sells her merchandise at reasonable prices.

This is Olimpia's 11th loan from MFP and she feels happy to know that she will once again have financial support.  Within her community bank, she is  punctual in making her loan repayments and she feels grateful that she is able to work with supportive people.

Olimpia will use her 2,000 soles to travel to the city of Lima to buy a wider range of clothes.  She will also buy some mannequins to display the clothing.

loans.use: to travel to the capital city to stock her business with more clothing

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel con su credikiva, se fue para el Carmen de Bolívar, compró en un importante volumen aguacates y  los vendió directamente y entre sus clientes distribuidores de frutas. Él se encuentra muy entusiasmada con su credikiva y ahora está solicitando uno nuevo para hacer una nueva  inversión en otra futa de mucha rentabilidad que se llama corozo y estará buscándola próximamente en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, uno de  los paradisiacos lugares de Colombia; lugar en el que se deleitará con la belleza de sus paisajes y realizará su nueva compra.
texts.en: Manuel used his previous Kiva loan to travel to El Carmen de Bolívar and buy a large quantity of avocados which he sold both directly and also to his customers who are fruit distributors.  He is very enthusiastic about his Kiva loan and is now requesting a new one so that he can make another investment in another very profitable [native] fruit called 'corozo'.  He will soon be traveling to La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, one of Colombia's heavenly locations, to buy it.  While he is there, he will enjoy the beauty of the landscape and make his purchase.

loans.use: to buy corozo fruit in bulk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 37 años, vive con su esposo Romaldo, de 41 años, y sus dos hijos: Ronaldo de 11 años y Gabriel de 7 años. La casa donde viven la compraron hace 10 años, gracias al esfuerzo de ella y de su esposo.
Se dedica a la venta de comestibles y otros productos de uso doméstico como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, verduras, conservas, gaseosas, galletas, detergentes, entre otros. Esta labor la realiza en la parte delantera de su casa desde hace 5 años. Normalmente su venta la hace sola, pero los días sábado y domingo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Para ella su trabajo es muy fácil, ya que también está al pendiente de sus hijos, quienes están en etapa escolar; pero sus molestias son cuando en su tienda quedan pocos productos y tiene que esperar hasta fin de semana para realizar sus compras y poder abastecer su negocio. Sonia se siente contenta de trabajar con lo que mejor sabe hacer, ya que también le genera buenos ingresos económicos. Con el tiempo quiere tener una tienda de venta al por mayor.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece a las personas quienes confían en su trabajo para darle la oportunidad de este préstamo. Se compromete responsablemente en ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, quienes le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar con ellos. 
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de mercadería en arroz, azúcar, detergentes, verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband, 41-year-old Romaldo, and her two children: 11-year-old Ronaldo and 7-year-old Gabriel.  They live in their own home that they bought ten years ago as a result of their hard work.

Sonia sells food products and other household products such as rice, sugar, mixed veg, canned food, vegetables, soda, cookies, detergents, etc.  She has been working in this business, in the front part of her home, for five years.  She normally works alone but on Saturdays and Sundays she has the support of her husband.  Her work is very easy as she also cares for her school-age children.  Problems arise, however, when her stock starts running low and she has to wait until the end of the week to make her purchases and re-stock her business.  Sonia feels happy doing what she knows best because it makes her good income.  In the future, she would like to own a wholesalers.

This is Sonia's first loan from MFP and she is grateful to people for trusting in her and giving her an opportunity with this loan.  She pledges to be punctual in making her repayments as she doesn't want to let down her community bank who gave her the opportunity to work with them.

Sonia will use her 1,000 soles to stock up with merchandise (rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables, etc.)

loans.use: to buy more products (rice, vegetables and detergents) to stock her store

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
For over three years in Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Annabel, a 35-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Annabel joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Lorelito, and she is the mother of their children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business.

Criselda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Criselda hopes her business will expand and that her children will have a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 64 years old and married with five children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Josefina has borrowed and paid for 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.en:
Ubaydullo is a man who works hard from early morning till late evening in order to improve his life. From childhood he was very hard-working. Some years ago he went to Russia and worked there. When he returned home he began his own business, dealing with animal husbandry. He has been engaged in this business for more than four years now. 

He has a large family. His wife is a kind woman, and tries to help him in all deals. They have four children and Ubaydullo must enter them in good schools. 

Ubaydullo wants to develop business further and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy young cattle. If you want to help anybody, please help Ubaydullo because he needs it.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to develop his business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Teresita owns and operates a beauty salon in her community. Teresita has been involved in her business for seven years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2009, Teresita joined GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of food and buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Finangnon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FINANGNON 2 est composé de vingt personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mivèmon est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mivèmon est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Mivèmon n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mivèmon est mariée à un instituteur du nom de Victor. Le couple a sept enfants dont certains scolarisés et cinq restent à leur charge. Mivèmon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Mivèmon vend divers céréales (riz, farine de manioc, haricot) et des fromages locaux dans sa région. Mivèmon s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mivèmon sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FINANGNON 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The FINANGON 2 group is comprised of twenty persons living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Mivèmon, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a teacher named Victor. The couple have seven children, some of whom attend school and five of whom they continue to care for. They all live together, and the couple together take care of the family needs. Mivèmon sells a variety of cereals (rice, manioc flour, beans) and local cheeses in order to take care of her family. She stocks up on products in the region in which she lives. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and revenus, she and the other members of the FINANGNON 2 group are asking for a second loan from ALIDE. She first loan was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Kiden Tabu

texts.en:
Kiden is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged three and five. One of them goes to school.

Kiden sells food, and has been in business for two years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase meat, rice and many other items. Aside from this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years Kiden would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Kiden says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy tems like meat, rice and beans.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 22-year-old lady from Kisumu. She is married to Zedekiah and together they have one kid who is five years old.

Maurine sells second hand clothes, a business she has done for the past five years. She makes an income of KES 21,000 monthly from it. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. and she intends to use it to purchase bails of second hand clothes. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay her loan well in time and pay for her child's school fees.

Her dream is to have a stable business and provide the essentials for the family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Yvette Emilie Sandrine

texts.fr: Yvette est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 31 ans, fiancée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 14 ans qui va à l'école. comme activité elle a une échoppe dans laquelle elle vend des biscuits, bonbons, détergents, du pain, etc... depuis 03 ans. avec ce crédit, elle voudrait acheter du riz, de l'huile et des arachides pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux repondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui va grandissante. elle envisage reinvestir une partie des bénéfices générés dans son activité et l'autre lui servira à mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Yvette is a young 31 year old Camerounian woman, engaged, and the mother of a 14 year old child who attends school. She has a stall from which she has been selling biscuits, sweets, detergents, bread, etc. for three years. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, oil and ground nuts to stock up on goods and respond to her customers growing requests. She plans to reinvest a portion of the profits generated into her business and use the rest to help take care of her family's daily needs.

loans.use: purchase grociers

loans.name: Odoi Charles

texts.fr: Homme de 60ans, Mr Odoi Charles est père de famille. Il a 03 enfants qui ont entre 35 et 28ans. Son épouse est revendeuse. Il est retraité. Pour encore bien  jouer son rôle de père de famille, en 2007 il a commencé par vendre les produits de mercerie à toute personne dans le besoin dans une boutique. Il est à son premier crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour s’approvisionner  en marchandises. Il veut avoir un stock considérable d’articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Mr Odoi Charles is a 60 year old father of a family of three children aged between 28 and 35 years old. His wife works in re-selling of goods. In order to allow him to continue taking care of his family, in 2007 he began selling fabric, yarn, needlework, buttons, etc, from a boutique. He is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on more merchandise and have available for sale a large variety of items.

loans.use: purchase fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Maria Elena, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue con su negocio de venta de flores y arreglos florales, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia. Maria Elena invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar un lote de flores para su comercio.
Maria Elena está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member’s name is Maria Elena.  She belongs to the “Cusco Sur” Communal Bank located in Cusco Peru.  Maria Elena continues selling flowers and floral arrangements and supports her family with this business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a batch of flowers for her business.

Maria Elena is very grateful to Kiva for helping her give her family a better quality of life and helping her grow and strengthen her business.  She is thankful for the loan and agrees to make the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase flowers.

loans.name: Samey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Kror Kor district where rice farming is a common way of making a living, Samey is a 26-year-old mother of two dependent children who are under school age. Rice farming is the main source of income for the family, and she and her husband have been involved in this for five years. Her husband supplements their income by catching fish for sale. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

This is the second microloan for Samey’s group with Kiva’s partner and they completely paid back the first loan. Samey successfully used the loan to buy a buffalo to help with her farming. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Samey, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy grocery items to run a grocery store. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source income for the family, so as to increase her income so they can have better living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 18 to 25. She describes herself as a jovial and humble woman. She operates a tailoring store where she sells curtains, couch covers etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in between two busy neighbourhoods and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads leading to her business premises which become impassable when it rains. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more materials to make couch-covers and curtains to resell to her customers. Her business goal is to be an interior decorator within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable with profits she will obtain from the business.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make curtains and couch-covers to sell.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is a married woman who has one child. April Rose is 26 years old, and resides at Dela Paz, Sibutad, Philippines. April Rose owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years and each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, April Rose joined GDMPC. In the future, April Rose wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix es de la ciudad de concepción, esta casado con la Sra. Patrocinia, tienen tres hijos. Él se dedica a vender leche por las mañanas y a la tarde trabaja en su negocio donde arregla equipos electrónicos, instala alarmas y equipos a los vehículos. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser un gran microempresario.
Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Es un hombre muy luchador y desea seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para materiales electrónicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar en su negocio para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felix is from the city of Concepción. He is married to Patrocinia and they have three children. He sells milk in the morning and in the afternoon works at his business where he fixes electronic items, and installs alarms and stereos in cars. He is a very hardworking person who really wants to go ahead and be a great micro-business man. 

He says that his dream is to keep growing and in this way give his family everything it needs for a life without deprivation. He is a fighter and wants to keep growing. 

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for electronic materials. He wants to use them in his business to keep giving his customers a good service.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for electronic items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Elsa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia en esta oportunidad a cambiado de rubro, ella esta apostando por la tecnología y ahora se dedica a vender productos de computo como insumos. Elsa invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar productos de computo como suministros, software y hardware para computadoras.
Elsa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su nueva actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the 'Cusco Sur' community bank, in the city of Cusco, Peru.  On this occasion, our member has changed her business.  She is betting on technology and now sells computer products and consumables.  She will invest the loan she has requested in buying computer supplies, software and hardware.

Elsa is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide her family with a better quality of life and for helping her to grow and strengthen her business.

Elsa is grateful for her loan and  pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Estanislado

texts.es:
el  señor estanislado,trabaja un un rancho a las afueras de choahuila donde es el administrador de ese rancho; con el sueldo  de esa actividada puede solventar los gastos de su casa asi como la manuntecion de su esposa.
unos de los propositos son, poner loza de concreto en uno de los cuartos  que se encuentran atrás de su vivienda
asi mismo dejarles en un futuro un patrimonio a sus hijos o  ponerlos en renta
para generar mas ingresos
construyendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Estanislado works on a ranch on the outskirts of Choahuila.  He is the ranch manager.  With his salary from this job he is able to cover his household expenses such as supporting his wife.  One of his aims is to lay a concrete floor in one of the rooms behind his home so that he can leave them to his children in the future or rent them out in order to make more income which will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries, like rice, sugar, oils, vegetables meats and more.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: ELLA TRABAJA PARA UNA MAQUILADORA PERO ACTUALMENTE SE ENCUNTRA INCAPACITADA DEBIDO A QUE POR EL CONSTASTE TRABAJAO REPETITIVO UNO DE SUS TENDONDES REQUIRIO DE UN INTERVENCION QUIRURJICA PERO DENTRO DE DOS SEMANAS VOVLERA A SUS TRABAJO RECUPERAD, POR SU PARTE SU ESPOSO TRABAJO COMO ALBAÑIL INDEPENDIENTE EN LAREDO TEXAS EVENTUALMENTE. AMBOS SE ESFUERZAN CON SUS EMPLEOS PARA PODERLE BRINDAR A SU HIJO LO MEJRO QUE SE PUEDA EL ESTA ESTUDIANDO LA SECUNDARIA Y ELLOS DESEA PODER SEGUIRLO PAOYANDO HASTA QUE CONCLUYA SUS ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS.
texts.en: This borrower worked for a factory, but right now she is disabled due to the constant, repetitive work. One of her tendons required surgery but in two weeks, she will be recovered and return to work. Her husband worked as an independent bricklayer in Laredo, Texas on and off. Both of them work at their jobs to be able to offer their son the best possible. He is in junior high school and they want to keep supporting him until he finishes the university.

loans.use: to start construction on a laundry room.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Moeun is a 56-year-old mother of six children living in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Cambodia. Out of her six children, she has three sons whose ages are over eighteen years, two of them are still in school, and the other helps support the family’s business. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland for almost thirty-five years, and her husband supplements the family’s income by making palm juice. The current business earns her about 27,400 KHR per day. The main challenge for her is the small income earned to support her children’s education until graduation. 

This is the first microloan for Moeun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Moeun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a piglet as additional income. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su pareja, John de 30 años, y sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace 7 años trabaja de forma independiente y está muy agradecida con Dios por darle esa oportunidad. Tiene un puesto donde vende ropa para todo tipo de personas, reconoce que esta labor la está beneficiando, pues sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito radica en la calidad y el precio de sus prendas. Con el tiempo piensa establecerse en su casa que ahora está en proceso de construcción, gracias a sus ahorros y las ganancias de su trabajo; allí podrá vender con mayor rapidez y comodidad.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, pues conoció de esta microfinanciera desde que inició su negocio. Agradece la confianza de facilitarle este préstamo y asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, como en anteriores créditos. 
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará más prendas de vestir para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Yovana is a charismatic, hardworking, twenty-six year old woman.  She lives in a rented house with her partner, thirty year old John, and her three children and wants to provide her family with a better quality of life.  

She has been working independently for seven years and is very thankful to God for giving her this opportunity.  She has a stall where she sells clothing for all types of people.  She recognizes that this work is benefitting her as her sales have increased with the passage of time.  The key to her success lies in the quality and price of her clothing.  Her home is presently under construction, thanks to her savings and profits from her business.  Eventually, she plans to establish the business in her home as she will be able to make sales more quickly and comfortably there.

This is her 14th loan with MFP so she has known about this microfinance institution since she started her business.  Yovana is grateful for the trust in providing this loan and promises to be punctual with her payments, as in previous loans.  She will use the loan to purchase more clothing for children and adults.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to contunue selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, está aumentando la variedad de sus productos en ropa y calzado, para esto necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo que le de los recursos económicos necesarios para la compra de calzado para damas de diferentes estilos y ropa en variedad de blusas, faldas, ropa interior, entre otras mercaderías que sea necesaria y que le dé una buena y mejor vistosidad al negocio.

Ella considera que está mejorando su calidad en el inventario del negocio, creciendo cada vez más en el mercado y teniendo mayor oportunidad de venta, en su familia sus condiciones económicas han mejorado pues cuenta con una fuente de ingreso un poco más estable a la que anteriormente tenían.
texts.en:
María wants to increase the variety of clothes and shoes she sells, and she needs to request a new loan providing her with the necessary economic resources to buy women shoes in different styles and a variety of clothes such as blouses, skirts, underwear and other products she might need to give a better and more colorful outlook to her shop.

She thinks she is improving the quality of her inventory, that she is growing more each day in the market and that she is having more sales opportunities. The economic conditions of her family have improved because the source of income they can now count on is more stable than the one they could previously rely on.

loans.use: To buy shoes, blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Ing's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Kror Kor district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Ing is aged 37 and widowed. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her six children by farming rice on one hectare of farmland, selling Khmer noodles in the village, and raising pigs on the site. Out of her six children, three are dependents and still in school. Having been in the business for several years, the current business earns her approximately 11,600KHR per day. 

Ing has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle, and she completely paid back the loan while her group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The first loan has helped her to afford a pig and buy a small plot of farmland. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy feed for her pig. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, age 42, lives with her family in a peaceful village in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. She is married to a local farmer and has four  children, all of whom attend school. Sok and her spouse help each other in maintaining a farming business to raise their children and provide them with a good education in the future. 

Sok grows various kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes and beans. She has been doing this business since her parents handed it to her. She generates around KHR 14,600 per day.

Recently, Sok is busy working on her rice and potato field. She really needs a few laborers to help her. For this reason, Sok would like to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 4,500,000 to pay laborers to transplant her rice and remove unwanted plants as well as rent a tractor to till the land for growing her potatoes.

Sok says that although she doesn’t have enough capital, she has the discipline and patience to achieve her goals in life. She is very thankful for the given funds, which will go a long way toward providing success for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to transplant her rice and remove unwanted plants as well as rent a tractor to till the land for growing her potatoes.

loans.name: Adjélé

texts.fr: Jeune dame active de 32ans, madame Adjélé est maman d’un adorable enfant de 11mois. Elle est secrétaire et revendeuse en même temps de pagnes, bijoux, mèches il y a 12ans. Elle le fait de façon ambulante et à domicile. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son cinquième cycle de prêt. Ce montant lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut éduquer et scolariser son enfant au coté de son mari qui est comptable et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Adjélé, age 32, is a young mother of an adorable 11-month-old child. She is a secretary and has been a reseller of pagnes, jewelry, and hair extensions for 12 years. She conducts her sales door-to-door and from her home.

She is a long-time client of WAGES currently on her fifth loan cycle. This new credit will allow her to stock up on merchandise to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her goal is to provide for her child’s education and schooling together with her husband, an accountant. She also wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, jewelry, and hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, age 49, who is a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Hilario, a laborer, and is a mother to her three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Hilda operates a dried-fish retailing business. She buys dried fish from wholesalers, repacks them and then sells them per pack for a profit. Products can range from dried fish to dried anchovies and other similar products. Customers are attracted to her business due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Hilda is requesting a PHP 33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Hilda dreams of having a good future. Her hope is that her children will finish their education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
This is Jenneth. She previously accessed a loan of 13,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities of a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 18,000 PHP for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jenneth dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase variety store inventory.

loans.name: Nyamlkhagva

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamlkhagva, 43 is a skilful, experienced railroader. Since 1991 he has been working as a railway man, but his monthly salary does not usually meet with his family's necessities. However he enjoys his job and his duties. He lives with his wife, 41, and his daughter in his old house which is located in the slum district in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.

Since his house was built, it has not been renovated. Every winter his family faces one big problem, that is of heat loss trough the wall and floor since the house is so old and not updated. It is detrimental to his family, harmful to their health and costly due to the fuel expenses. Therefore he has decided to insulate his house wall. Insulating the house needs foam, cement and other building materials.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit a lot of pollution every night, from families just trying to stay warm. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas. The loan he is taking will be used to buy insulation materials to insulate his house walls to prevent heat loss.

loans.use: To buy some insulation materials to insulate his house walls.

loans.name: Wendi

texts.es:
Wendi tiene 64 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y alegre. Su esposo, el padre de su hija murió y actualmente vive con otra pareja, su hija y su nieto, a quien quiere mucho. Su casa es propia, la que compró con la ayuda de su difunto esposo.
Su actividad es la venta de almuerzos, tales como arroz chaufa, pollos fritos,  asados de pollo y otros platillos que sabe preparar. Cuenta con dos mesas y algunas sillas que instala en el frontis de su casa, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su hija. También vende gaseosas y golosinas, para ello cuenta con una exhibidora donde guarda estas bebidas a la temperatura que les agrada a sus clientes por lo caluroso de la región. Inició hace más de 6 años y lo que le gusta es que puede contar con un ingreso económico, además de estar en la comodidad de su casa, se siente una persona productiva y le distrae. Por otro lado, tiene una regular clientela, la que se supo ganar con el trascuerdo del tiempo.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de platillos; como arroz, aceites, pollos, carnes, verduras y otros. Así como bebidas y golosinas al por mayor, buscando conseguir menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Wendi is happy, enterprising, 64 year old woman.  Her husband, the father of her daughter, died and now she lives with another partner, her daughter, and her granddaughter, who she loves very much.  She owns her home, which she bought with her deceased husband’s help.

She is in the business of selling lunches such as “arroz chaufa” (Chinese fried rice), roasted chicken, and other dishes that she knows how to prepare.  She has two tables and some chairs set up in front of her home.  Her daughter helps her in the business.  She also sells soda and candy, and has a display case where she keeps the beverages at a pleasing temperature for her customers as the region is very warm. She started her business more than six years ago and she likes having the income and working in the comfort of her home.  She feels productive and it amuses her.  In addition, she has regular customers that she has managed to gain over time.  

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has their financial support as this enables her to feel confident in continuing her business.  She promises, once again, to make her payments on time, as with the previous loan she had.  She will invest the 2000 nuevos soles she is requesting in the purchase of supplies and ingredients for the preparation of her dishes; rice, oil, chicken, meat, vegetables, and other items.  In addition, she will purchase wholesale soda and candy at lower prices to obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul is young and strong-minded. He is very intelligent and works very hard at improving his living. He has  his own business for more than two years. He sells mobile telephones and notebook computers. He is persistent and has many customers. His business has developing day by day. 

Abdurasul has a lovely wife and a smart child.  He loves his wife and child very much. His wife doesn’t have a job, and that’s why Abdurasul must comfort his family with all the necessary things alone. 

He wants to buy mobile telephone and notebook computers for developing his business.  You are the only one who can help him. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy moblie phones and notebook computers for developing his business.

loans.name: Edina Kiden

texts.en:
Edina Kiden is 30 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She lives in Juba and runs a food store, which she has been doing for two years.
 
Edina Kiden is requesting a loan for 500 SDG, which she will use to purchase dodo (leafy greens), oranges, onions, and other food items. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She has no other source of income.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  In the future, Edina Kiden would like to expand her  business.

loans.use: to purchase dodo (leafy greens), oranges, onions, and other food items.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and lives with his parents.  Nine years ago Abdurahmon began his own business selling vegetables. He buys vegetables from other regions and sells to local people.  He has many customers because his prices are low. His wife helps him with the business. 

Abdurahmon is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy vegetables for the new season.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for the new season.

loans.name: Ahlimba

texts.fr: Madame Ahlimba est âgée de 44ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place et ont ensemble 02 enfants qui fréquentent. Ils sont âgés de 19 et 07ans. Elle est revendeuse de profession et cela depuis 1991. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de kom « une nourriture préparée à base de maïs qui se mange avec de la tomate fraiche et du poisson et cela très appréciée par la population togolaise ». Ses enfants l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité qu’elle même à domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour s’approvisionner en pagnes et en maïs. Elle voudrait à l’avenir renforcer son activité et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ahlimba is 44 years old. Her husband works for a local company, and they have two children aged 7 and 19 who both go to school. 

She has been a reseller since 1991. Her income-generating activity is the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and “kom”, a maize-based dish served with fish and fresh tomatoes that is well liked by the people of Togo. She works door-to-door and from her home, with the help of her children. 

This is her second loan cycle with WAGES, and she will use this credit to stock up on pagnes and maize. 

She wants to strengthen her activity and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and maize.

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
Janeth, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita realizar la compra de materia prima para el negocio de las tortillas, se comprara 10 sacos de maíz, y unas cargas de leña, pues esto le permitirá la producción de tortillas para un largo tiempo y la obtención de los precios de estos productos a un costo menor.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar la venta de las tortillas, ya que tenía a la mano los recursos necesarios para aumentar su producción y poder mejorar las ventas a los clientes, sus condiciones en el negocio están mejorando y está proveyendo mejores ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Janeth is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy basic ingredients to prepare tortillas, in order to obtain these products at a lower price. She will buy 10 sacks of corn and some loads of firewood, as this will help her producing tortillas for a long time.

The previous loan has helped her improving her tortillas sale, as she has been able to keep at hand all the necessary means to increase her production, and she has succeeded in improving the sale rate to her customers. The conditions of her shop are improving and she is earning a better income to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn and some loads of firewood.

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sampov Meas district, Souy is 47 years old and married. She has eight children.  Four of them are staying with the family, working as construction workers or going to school. 

Souy is a rice farmer of three hectares of farmland, while her husband is a construction worker. Having been in this business for almost 30 years, she currently can earn about KHR 12,900 per day. 

This is a microloan for Souy’s group of three, and this is her second loan. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy chickens to raise for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry to raise as an addition to her farming.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
This is Florenia.  She is 67 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband passed away, leaving her with three children, who are working already. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Florenia operates a junk shop.  Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines.  While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Florenia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will add the money to her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from trash scavengers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florenia hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable trash to process and sell to manufacturers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Say is a farmer who owns approximately three hectares of farm land on which she grows various kinds of crops, including rice and potatoes. To supplement the income from the farm, she raises pigs for fattening and sells them to local butchers. She is able to help her husband earn household income, so that they are able to provide food, medicines, education, and basic living needs for their children. 

Say wants to improve her business and upgrade her living conditions. She is requesting a loan from HKL, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for transportation for the family. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy feed for her pigs. Say hopes that she is able to improve her living conditions through the positive impact of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Patrick started out as a merchant over a year ago. He began with some money he’d saved working as an employee in a retail shop for several years. He now has a large clientele in the community because of his good service and the variety of products he offers in his store.

He’s asking for a loan to buy shoes to stock the store and to provide a wider variety for his customers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of shoes for resale

loans.name: Tito Cosme

texts.fr: Tito Cosme est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Tito Cosme a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et est marié à une marchande du nom de Élisabeth. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants de Tito Cosme sont scolarisés. Tito Cosme vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Tito Cosme a appris la couture, activité qu’il exerce depuis une dizaine d’année dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Tito Cosme devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Tito Cosme désire acquérir de nouvelles machines. Tito Cosme s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Tito Cosme sollicite une quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Tito Cosme is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He attended primary school. He is married to a merchant named Elisabeth, and the couple have four dependent children, three of them being their own. Some of the children go to school. Tito Cosme lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together.
