José tiene 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo. Está casado con Sarela, de 60 años, con quien tiene una hija. Actualmente vive en compañía de su esposa, su hija, su pareja y su nieto.
Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas y golosinas. Para esto cuenta con una pequeña bodega  que logró acondicionar en su vivienda. Empezó hace 7 meses notando las necesidades de sus vecinos y transeúntes y buscando generar un ingreso económico. Paralelamente se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con el auto que tiene. Le gusta su actividad, pues le permite contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios, y tener tiempo para el trasporte, que le genera otros ingresos económicos. Tiene planes de hacer incrementar el stock de sus productos y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes.

Este es el préstamo número 5 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes con personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará mayor variedad de gaseosas y golosinas. Buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and is a very kind and modest man. He is married to Sarela, who is 60 years old, and together they have one daughter. Currently he lives with his wife, his daughter, his daughter's partner and his grandson.

He has a business selling soft drinks and candy. He has a small store that he was able to set up in his home. Seven months ago he started noticing the needs of his neighbors and passers-by and he was looking to create a source of income. At the same time he also works providing transport for passengers with his car. He likes his business because it allows him to have a necessary income and because he has time for his transport business, which gives him additional income. His plans are to increase his product stock and diversify the variety of items he carries so that he can increase customer satisfaction.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support because he will feel more secure in being able to make progress in his work. On the other hand, once again he commits himself to making his payments, as he has done with his previous loans. He is grateful to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive.

With the 1000 nuevos soles that he has requested he will purchase a greater variety of soft drinks and candy. He will look for low prices by making his purchases in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and candies to continue selling.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es: Edgar, es un joven agricultor originario de la comunidad El Jícaro en las afueras de Estelí, se dedica a  la siembra de hortalizas. Ya es un cliente recurrente de nuestra institución. Su primer crédito fue el que recibió con fondos Kiva el cual le permitió sembrar una manzana de cebolla, comprar insumos, pagar  mano de obra . El está muy agradecido por el cambio positivo que logro realizar pues no tenía suficiente capital con que iniciar sus siembras. Ahora con el objetivo de lograr uno de sus anhelados propósitos requiere un segundo crédito para ampliar una nueva área de siembras de tomate y comprar insumos tales como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas. El espera sacar una producción de calidad que le permita vender a un buen precio y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar’s a young farmer from the community of El Jícaro in Estelí’s outskirts.  He grows vegetables.  He is a returning client of the institution.  

His first loan was the one he got with Kiva funds which made it possible for him to plant a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of onions, buy supplies and pay labor costs.  He is very grateful for the positive change he attained because he did not have enough capital to start his planting with.  

Now, with the goal of attaining one of his desired ends he needs a second loan to expand into a new planting area and plant tomatoes.  He will buy supplies like fertilizer, manure and seeds.  He hopes to get a quality harvest that can be sold at a good price which will provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina's day is usually spent attending to her customers’ requests. She is 44 years old and a sari-sari (variety store) owner from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with one daughter who is 17 years old. 

Vivina would like to increase her inventory but can hardly do so due to limited capital. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like noodles, canned goods, toiletries, soft drinks, snack food, and seasoning. 

She plans to improve her business so that she can increase business profitability. Her loan request will supply her with needed merchandise.

Any additional income will be used for her child’s education and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, canned goods, toiletries, soft drinks, snack food, and seasoning.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells oranges at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is married and has 7 children. She uses the money from her orange-selling business to pay her children’s school fees. Her husband is a farmer. 

Esi has been selling oranges for 15 years. Her loan will be used to buy more oranges to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to continue paying her children’s school fees, to help them obtain a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy more oranges to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Abena sells oranges at Dompoase, which she has done for 3 years. The money from her business is spent on her children’s school fees. Her husband is a farmer. Abena will use the loan to purchase more oranges to sell. With the new profits, Abenawa plans to to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges to sell.

loans.name: Mangi

texts.en:
Mangi is 32 years old, a married man and a resident of Kaloleni, Kenya. He has 4 children, between 5 and 12 years of age. He has been operating a café for more than five years. In addition, he owns a kiosk with which his wife helps to run. 

He is hardworking and has many clients. He is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 from Yehu to purchase beans, wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. Mangi's aspiration is to open a shop, and he believes this can be achieved in the short term. 

Mangi lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa sells oranges and maize at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. The money from her orange and maize selling business goes towards helping her husband pay for their children’s school fees. Her husband is a tailor. 

Abenawa has been selling oranges and maize for the past 10 years. Her loan will be used to buy more oranges and maize. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oranges and maize.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Doña Estela,  tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con una hija en un barrio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
Doña Estela tiene 10 años de haber establecido su propio negocio donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, jabón, refrescos, churros, condimentos etc. de este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sus gastos de alimentación y otros del hogar. ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF, actualmente solicita el préstamo numero catorce por 15,000 Lempiras y también lo invertirá en la pulpería para surtir de maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, etc. para tener que ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir creciendo en el negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Su meta es vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en: Estela, 54, is a single mother; she lives with a daughter in a neighborhood in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  She opened her own business selling foodstuffs like basic grins, lard, sugar, soap, soft-drinks, snacks, condiments, etc. ten years ago.  The business produces income needed for her food and other household expenses.  She’s been able to stay in business thanks to ODEF loans.  She’s currently asking for loan #14 for 15,000 lempiras that she will also invest in the grocery store to stock it with corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, soap, etc. in order to have stock available to offer her customers and to continue growing in the business and increasing sales.  Her goal is to live better with her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 36 años, tiene 2 hijos, vive en unión libre,  y reside en una aldea rural del municipio Santa Cruz  de Yojoa. 
Maria se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de (granos básicos, harina de trigo, manteca, arroz, frijoles, maseca,  consomé de pollo, sal, azúcar) y productos de abarrotería y medicamentos.  Ella inicio su negocio con sus propios ahorros y además con la ayuda de financiamientos. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la ampliación de su negocio, aumentando el inventario para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes como (frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, harina y productos de abarrotería). Manifiesta estar motivada a seguir adelante ya que los ingresos que obtiene le permiten suplir las necesidades de su familia. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 36, has two children and lives in a common law relationship; she lives in a rural village in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  For the last three years María has been selling basic grains, wheat flour, lard, rice, beans, Maseca [brand of corn flour], chicken consommé, salt, sugar, groceries and medicines.  She started the business with her own funds and with help from loans.

She’s currently asking for a 5000 lempira loan to invest in expanding the business increasing inventory to offer a variety of goods to her customers such as: beans, rice, sugar, lard, beans, flour and groceries.  She states that she’s motivated to continue forward because income she earns allows her to meet her family’s needs.  Her goal is to continue working in order to move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
a señora ines cuenta con una tienda hubicada en su casa
cual esta atendidapor su esposo
vive solo con su esposo ya que sus hijos ya estan grande
ines desea tener un mayoringreso 
pero para eso nececita hacer pagos de nueva mercancia que decea
adquiri,para poder dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder llevar un poko mas de ingresos na su casa 
asi a la vez recuperarse de las malas rachas que han enfrentado 
y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Ines has a corner grocery in her house which she operates with her husband.
She and her husband live alone because their children are grown.
Ines wants to increase her income and she is applying for a loan to stock her store with merchandise that will allow her to provide a wider range of products to her customers.
She hopes the investment will bring more money in and help her to recover from a recent run of bad luck.
The extra income will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her retail grocery business.

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es: Andres, de oficio comerciante , nos comparte su agradecimiento por haber recibido su primer préstamo Kiva , el cual utilizo para comprar lubricantes y surtir su negocio , el noto que sus ingresos fueron mejorando incluso se ha propuesto poner otro local con el objetivo de expandirse y mejorar su local , a la vez agradece porque ha podido mantener a sus hijos estudiando. El está requiriendo un segundo crédito para comprar lubricantes de nueva marcas que le han estado solicitando sus clientes, pues su negocio se caracterizado a que ofrece variedad y calidad   a sus clientela. Su deseo es prosperar con su negocio y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Andres, a merchant, shares his gratefulness with us for having received his first Kiva loan, which he used to buy lubricants and stock his business. He said that his income was improving and also suggested opening another shop in order to expand and improve his business. He is also grateful because he has been able to keep his children in school. He is requesting a second loan to buy new brands of lubricant that have been requested by his customers. His business is known for offering a variety of quality products to his customers. He wants his business to thrive and to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy lubricants

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is married and has four children. He has been a merchant for more than 1 year. He is hardworking and dedicated. Thanks to all of his efforts, his children are studying. He says that he never had the opportunity to study. Therefore, his greatest wish is to see all of his children become professionals so that they can have a better future. He has a well-stocked grocery store in his home where he sells food and drinks.

Raphael tells us that his business is doing very well because he has good customers and is well known in his area for his good customer service and the good prices he offers. Thanks to his work, he is able to maintain his household and cover any out-of-pocket expenses.

Raphael is requesting this loan to buy basic household products for his business such as sugar, canned food, meat, drinks, etc. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving as it will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned food, meat, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es:
Will, tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Aldea Barrial de Choloma, Cortes.
Will, lleva 10 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería de forma ambulante, se moviliza de un lugar a otro mediante un pequeño troco. El vende ropa interior para caballeros y para damas como sostenes, blúmeres, bikinis y sandalias. Para el este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y le ha ido bien, ha invertido dos préstamos anteriores y ha visto cambio en su negocio, ahora solicita el tercero que es de 22,000 Lempiras para comprar más ropa nueva para surtir el negocio e incrementar las ventas y sus ganancias. Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un nivel mejor de vida.
texts.en: Will, 34, is married and has three children; he lives with his family in the village of Barrial de Choloma, Cortes.  He’s been selling varied merchandise from place to place for ten years.  He goes from one place to another in a small dolly.  He sells underwear for man and women like bras, bloomers, bikinis and sandals.  This business is his source of income and he’s done well.  He’s invested two previous loans and has seen how his business has changed.  Now, he’s asking for the third loan for 22,000 lempiras to buy more new clothes to stock the business and increase sales and profits.  His dream is to provide a good education for his children and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new underwear.

loans.name: Carolina Yamileth

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con sus hijos, una tía y hermanos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Hace 5 años que Carolina logro alquilar un local en el mercado de la ciudad para establecer el negocio y vende ropa para niños, blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior para adultos. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos  de donde sostiene a su familia. Esta solicitando 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mercadería nueva y surtir el negocio, ella espera incrementar las ventas ofreciendo variedad de productos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 21, is a single mother, and she has two children.  She lives with her children, an aunt, and her siblings in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Five years ago Carolina managed to rent a place at the city market.  She did this to establish her business of selling children’s clothes, blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear for adults.  This business is her source of income to support her family.

She is requesting 10,000 lempiras to buy new merchandise and to stock her store.  She hopes to increase sales by offering a variety of products.  Her dream it to have a big business.

loans.use: to stock her business with clothes for children, women, and men.

loans.name: Nohemi Yolany

texts.es:
Nohemí, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.
Ella tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos, cremas y lociones. el préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras, es el octavo préstamo solicitado a ODEF y va comprar mercadería nueva para su negocio y va hacer una reparación a su casa para ampliar el local del negocio. Ella es muy conocida en la aldea y la prefieren por mantener mejores precios. Su sueño es ver graduados a sus hijos y tener un local adecuado para el negocio.
texts.en:
Nohemí, 38, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in a village belonging to the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  She’s been selling merchandise for nine years.  The business is located at home and she sells clothes for women, men and children as well as  shoes, creams and lotions.  

She’s asking for a 15000 lempira loan, her 8th requested from ODEF, to buy new merchandise for her business; she will also do a home repair in order to expand the space for her store.  She is very well-known in the village and she’s preferred because she has the best prices.  Her dream is to see her children graduate and to have a site that’s set up properly for her business.

loans.use: to stock her store and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba tiene 52 años de edad, tiene un hijo es madre soltera y vive con su madre en una Colonia Suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz,  compra el maíz, cal y leña para elaborar las totillas. Este negocio lo estableció con sus propios esfuerzos y poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer. ya tiene una buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cal y leña  para elaborar las tortillas y va destinar un dinero para reparar el techo del negocio. El préstamo le ayudara a tener capital disponible para trabajar y a mantener insumos que necesita. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, has a son and she’s a single mother.  She lives with her mother in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She’s been making and selling corn tortillas for 8 years.  She buys corn, lime powder and firewood to make the tortillas.  She started the business with her own efforts and has made it grow gradually; she now has a well-established clientele.

She needs the loan to buy corn, lime powder and firewood to make tortillas and will use part of the money to repair the business’ roof.  The loan will help her have capital on hand to work and have the ingredients she needs.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortillas and sheet metal to repair the kitchen roof.

loans.name: Dilcia Aracely

texts.es:
Dilcia  de 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene hijo, vive en el municipio de San Juan Pueblo. 
Doña Dilcia, hace 1 año y cinco meses  que comenzó vendiendo baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena de frijoles, huevo, queso, mantequilla y otros), pero su demanda creció y le pedían otra clase de comidas, esto la motivo a vender almuerzos, desayunos y cenas también. Abre su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7de la noche atendiendo su clientela. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras a ODEF para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, harina, frijoles, arroz, condimentos etc. 
Como meta ella piensa incrementar sus clientes ofreciendo variedad de comida.
texts.en:
.
Dilcia, 31, lives in a common law relationship and has a son; she lives in the municipality of San Juan Pueblo.  A year and five months ago she started selling “baleadas” (flour tortilla stuffed with beans, egg, cheese, butter and others) but demand grew and she was being asked for other types of dishes which motivated her to start selling lunch, breakfast and dinners too.  She opens at 7am and goes until 7pm tending to her clientele.

She’s asking ODEF for a 7000 lempira loan to buy ingredients to prepare food like meat, vegetables, flour, beans, rice, condiments, etc.  Her goal is to increase her customers by offering a variety of food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Don Martin, tiene 70 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos  vive  en el municipio de Choloma Cortes.
Don Martin, desde joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva plátano y hortalizas  para la venta y consumo. Esta es su única fuente de ingresos de los cuales aporta al hogar, el vende su producto en su casa donde llegan los compradores y también los distribuye en el mercado local. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 21,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento y comprar insumos para preparar la tierra para cultivar. 
Su plan es que con esta inversión él espera mejorar las cosechas para obtener mejores ingresos, ya que con las ganancias que obtenga espera poder construir una vivienda cómoda para su familia.
texts.en:
Martín’s 70-year-old, married and has three children.  He lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  Since he was young Martín has worked in agriculture; he grows bananas and vegetables to sell and to consume.  This is his only source of household support income.  He sells his products at home where buyers come and also sells them in the local market.

He’s asking for a 21000 lempira loan to buy supplies to prepare the soil and provide crop maintenance.  His plan is that this investment will improve his crops so that he will earn improved income since he plans to use profits obtained to build a more comfortable dwelling for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty sells soft drinks at Dompoase, near Elmina. Gifty has received schooling though the junior high school level.  She is single. Gifty has been selling soft drinks for the past six months. The profits from her business will be used to help pay her bills and cover other financial responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a widow and has seven children. She sells kenkey (cooked and fermented maize dough) at Dompoase, near Elmina, which she has done for one year. Aba uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and other household expenses, such as bills and food. Aba will use this loan to purchase maize and other ingredients for her kenkey. With the new profits, Aba plans to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase maize and other ingredients for her kenkey.

loans.name: Abboskhon

texts.en: Abboskhon is a man who likes to work hard. For more than eight years, he has been busy with driving. He has his own lorry and serves local people by driving their goods from one place to another. He has a very friendly family. He has two children and a lovely wife. He wants to develop his business, but his lorry has broken and Abboskhon must repair it. He is asking for a loan to repair his lorry. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To repair his lorry

loans.name: Sergio Sigfredo

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio, tiene 39 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos  en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula cortes, tiene 3 hijos 19,12 y 3 años de edad los cuales están estudiando.
Su actividad económica actual, es la sastrería, confeccionando trajes para toda ocasión, uniformes para escuelas, colegios, e instituciones públicas y privadas. Ha logrado establecer su negocio de sastrería desde hace 20 años con mucho esfuerzo, trabajo y además con el apoyo de su esposa. La limitante que ha tenido es la carencia de recursos que le permite cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Actualmente ha decidido solicitar su primer préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para poder abastecer de materiales e insumos (telas, hilos, utensilios de costura). Él esta considerando utilizar sus ganancias para ampliar su negocio y buscar una superación que le permita mejorar su condición económica y lograr la sostenibilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Sergio, 39, lives with his wife and children in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  He has three children who are 19, 12 and 3 years old all of which are studying.

His current activity is tailoring; he makes outfits for all occasions, school uniforms and uniforms for public and private institutions.  He opened his tailor shop twenty years ago with much effort and with his wife’s support.  His only limiting factor is the lack of resources  needed to meet customer demand.

He’s decided, therefore, to request his first, 10,000 lempira, loan to stock up on materials and supplies (fabric, thread, sewing supplies).  He’s considering using his profits to expand the business and seek improvement that will make it possible for him to improve his economic situation and attain family sustainability.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Doña Leonor tiene 52 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en aldea el Ciruelo, municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.
Hace 20 años que doña Leonor presta el servicio de sastrería en la comunidad, ella confecciona todo tipo de vestidos, trajes para damas y caballeros y ropa de niño. Ella es muy conocida en la comunidad por su excelente trabajo que realiza. El préstamo que solicita es el séptimo y es por 5,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar telas y todo material que necesita para su taller de costura. Teniendo telas en existencia los clientes le hacen más pedidos. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y llegar a tener empleados que le ayuden a la confección de ropa y lograr que su hija se gradúe en una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Leonor, 52, is married and has four children; she lives in the village of El Ciruelo in Macuelizo Municipality, Santa Bárbara.  She’s been supplying sewing services to her community for 20 years.   She makes all kinds of dresses, outfits for women and men and children’s clothes.  She’s very well-known in the community because of the good work she does.

The loan she’s requesting is the 7th one and it’s for 5,000 lempiras that she’s going to use to buy fabric and all the other supplies she needs for her sewing shop.  Having fabric on hand leads to more customer orders.  Her goal is to grow in her business and someday hire employees to help her make clothes and also manage to have her daughter graduate in a professional career.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells bread at Dompoase in Elmina, Ghana.  She is divorced and has one child.  Efua has been selling bread for 10 years.  She uses her income to pay for her child’s school fees and other household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy flour and sugar to make bread.  She hopes to use the profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children, ranging in age from 13 to 20 years old. She describes herself as a creative and God-fearing woman. 

Mary operates a retail stall business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the shortage of clothes for resale. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a lucrative businesses.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris sells pollo (a local pastry made with coconut) at Dompoase. Doris has completed schooling though junior high school.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Doris has been selling pollo for the past six years. She uses her income to help her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy flour and sugar to make her pollo. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to make her pollo.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has six children. She sells corn dough at Dompoase, near Elmina, which she has done for 15 years. Efua uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and to pay all other financial obligations such as feeding and clothing her family and paying bills. She will use this loan to purchase maize in bulk. With the new profits, Efua plans to help support her family.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Eudocia

texts.es: Doña María tiene 55 años de edad, es casada hace 36 años, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, algunos de ellos ya son independientes, vive con su familia en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Su negocio es una pulpería de productos alimenticios como (arroz, manteca, harina, frijoles, pan, etc.), abarrotes y algunos productos enlatados. Este negocio lo estableció hace 9 años con sus propios medios. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con el fin de generar otro ingreso extra que le ayudaría a contribuir con los gastos del hogar fue que logro establecerlo. Ella le dedica 8 horas al negocio. Doña María ha obtenido varios financiamientos con ODEF que la han ayudado a mejorar su negocio, en la actualidad solicita otro préstamo de 21,000 lempiras a Kiva, para abastecerse de productos de la canasta básica. (Arroz, manteca, Frijoles, harina, azúcar, huevos, churros etc ).Con lo que va a invertir va mejorar sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir trabajando para que sus ingresos puedan ser mejores cada día y poderle dar el estudio a su hija y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
María, 55, has been married for 36 years and has six adult children; some of them are already independent.  She lives with her family in a village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Her business is a grocery store where she sells food items like rice, lard, flour, beans, bread, groceries and some canned goods.  She started the business nine years ago with means of her own.  She is a very hardworking woman and wanting to generate additional income to help her contribute towards household expenses she succeeded in establishing it.  She spends 8 hours daily at work.

María has gotten several ODEF loans that have helped her improve her store and is currently asking for another one from Kiva for 21,000 lempiras to stock up on basic staple items (rice, lard, beans, flour, sugar, eggs, snacks, etc.).  With her investment, income will improve.  Her goal is to continue working so that her income will be better every day and to be able to provide schooling for her daughter and to grow in the business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells watermelon at Dompoase, near Elmina.  She is married and has six  children. Aba has been selling watermelon for two years now. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and her husband pays the other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more watermelons. She hopes to use the new profits to invest in her children’s futures by promoting their education through paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has eight children. She sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Dompoase, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase more cassava. With the new profits, Ama plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: A widowed mother of two, Adjoa has been selling Fante kenkey (cooked and fermented maize or cassava dough) in Dompoase for three years now. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to produce kenkey. Adjoa is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and other household expenses, and she hopes to use the new profits to better support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more maize to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Celeste - 26 Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento CELESTE- 26
Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María tiene 53 años, casada con dos hijos mayores de 25 años ya independientes, La Sra. María  se dedica  a la venta de joyas enchapadas en oro en su joyería que se encuentra ubicado en una de las calles más populares de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  variedad de joyas por mayor  y así ofrecer variedad de joyas a sus clientes  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Communal Bank: CELESTE- 26

It has nine members, eight women and one man.  The bank president is María, 53.  She’s married and has two children who are over 25-years-old and already independent.  María sells gold plated jewelry in her jewelry store located in one of the city of La Paz’s most popular streets.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution.

María will use this loan to buy assorted jewelry at wholesale to offer a wider selection of jewelry to her customers thus providing better customer service and increasing her profits.  The reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving the business.  María is a very hardworking woman who feels happy for the opportunity being provided her and her fellow group members since in some cases they are their families’ sole source of support.

loans.use: to buy gold plated jewelry at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 39 años vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, en su domicilio tiene adecuada la sala de su casa donde ubico su zapatería, tiene una maquina cosedora y una mesa para realizar los cortes del cuero. Comenzó el negocio como un juego aprendiendo como confeccionar los zapatos pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que le gustaba emprendiendo el negocio de manera particular. El trabajo no lo realiza solo, tiene 2 ayudantes los cuales tienen a su cargo determinadas funciones. El costo que invierte en la creación de las zapatillas es de $2.30 y lo vende a $ 5.50 obteniendo una ganancia de $ 3.20 lo que le permite cubrir costos y gastos. La mayor competencia que tiene es el mercado chino ya que por volumen sus productos son más económicos, a esto se suma que los clientes ven el costo pero no la calidad. Juan empleara el dinero del préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando plantillas, cuero, clavo e hilos. Espera a futuro crecer en el negocio para poder terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil.  He has a shoemaking workshop in the living room of his house with a sewing machine and a table for cutting leather.  He started his business as a game, learning how to make shoes.  However, over time he realized that he would like to start working privately.  He does not work alone but has two assistants who each have different duties.  He invests $2.30 into making his shoes and sells each pair for $5.50, making a profit of $3.20 which allows him to cover his costs and expenses.  The biggest competition he has is the Chinese market because, owing to their high production volume, their products are cheaper.  He adds that customers see the cost but not the quality.  Juan will use his loan money to increase his working capital.  He will buy insoles, leather, tacks and thread.  He hopes, in the future, to grow his business so that he can finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy insoles, leather, tacks and thread

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa, a widow with six children, has been selling banku (cooked and fermented maize or cassava dough) in Dompoase, near Elmina, for 15 years. She uses her income to clothe and feed her children and pay their school fees. Now requesting a loan to purchase maize in bulk, Adjoa will use the new profits to continue to send her children to school and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is happily married and has four children who are greatly loved. Stella is the owner of a small store. She started the store more than two years ago with her and her husband’s savings. Gradually they began building the business and now it supports the family.

She requested this loan to purchase flour, noodles, sugar, cookies, vegetables, etc. because she has very good customer demand for the products she sells. Her wish is that the business continue prospering as it is doing now so that it can provide the family with a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, noodles, sugar, cookies, vegetables,

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La compra de carne de res, cerdo, queso y materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes y accesorios de costura, fue la inversión que hizo Carmen con su credikiva y que la tiene muy contenta, porque rotó ligeramente su capital, fue complaciente con sus clientes y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. Por eso envía a sus financiadores el siguiente mensaje: “Estoy muy agradecida y me siento muy contenta porque me sirvió mucho el préstamo para aumentar mi negocio.” Hoy Carmen  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará telas e insumos, para elaborar faldas en telas de jeans y bolsos, los cuales fabricará, creando nuevos diseños, para estar en el marco de la moda   que sus clientes quieren tener, para sentirse felices y muy distinguidos
texts.en:
Carmen used her Kiva loan to buy beef, pork, cheese and raw materials like fabric, thread, lace and sewing accessories.  She’s very happy because she turned over her capital a bit; she satisfied her customers thanks to her Kiva loan.  Because of this, she’s sending the following message to her lenders: “I am very grateful and feel very happy because the loan was very useful for me to increase my business.”

Today, Carmen is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy fabric and supplies to make denim skirts and purses that she’ll manufacture with new designs in order to be on the cutting edge of fashion which is what her customers want to have to feel happy and distinguished.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for the beauty salon

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento DIVINO NIÑO, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varónes,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Clementina   vive por la localidad de la Guardia, ella tiene 45 años y dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 17 años, La Sra. Clementina  se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Clementina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos por mayor como papa, arroz, fideo y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Clementina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela. La Sra. Clementina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The “Divino Niño” (Holy Child) communal bank has 8 members; six women and two men.  The bank’s president is Clementina who lives in La Guardia.  She’s 45-years-old and has two children who are 19 and 17 years old.  Clementina sells food in a stand located in the same zone where she lives.  This loan will be her second sequence in the institution.  Clementina will use this loan to buy ingredients at wholesale like potatoes, rice, noodles and oil to prepare her food thus increasing her working capital.  The reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving the business.  Clementina will use profits to continue to buy supplies thus improving her income.  Her wish for the business is to have a restaurant and offer more comfort to her customers.  Clemetina is a very hardworking person who is happy about the opportunity provided her and her fellow group members since in some cases they are their families’ sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Marcos Arturo

texts.es: Marcos vive en la ciudad de Playas zona costera de Ecuador y muy apreciada por su gastronomía y hermosas playas. a vivido toda su vida aquí y se dedica al trasporte de carga. A sus 38 años se encuentra soltero y sin hijos pero espera a futuro cambiar ese estatus y encontrar una buena mujer interesada en un hombre trabajador como él. Hace varios años Marcos poseía una embarcación pesquera pero como algunos de sus compañeros sufrió un asalto por lo que perdió su embarcación y producto, ese episodio vivido es lo que más preocupa a quienes se dedican a este negocio. Gracia a Dios no tuvo un triste desenlace y pudo regresar a su casa, a partir de esto decidió comprar una camioneta con la que trasporta a los pescadores hasta el muelle llevando las embarcaciones para salir a la pesca. Su trabajo empieza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de lunes a sábados. Con el préstamo Marcos va a comprar las 4 llantas nuevas para su camioneta ya que están deterioradas y no desea sufrir ningún tipo de accidentes. Con el tiempo espera mejorar el servicio que brinda cambiando su camioneta o realizarle mejores arreglos.
texts.en: Marcos lives in Playas, a coastal town in Ecuador which is very well known for its cuisine and beautiful beaches.  Marcos has lived his whole live here and his business is transporting goods.  He is 38 years old, single, and doesn't have any children though he hopes to change this status in the future and find a nice woman who is interested in a hard-working man like himself.  Some years ago, Marcos used to own a fishing boat but some of his friends were robbed and they lost their boat and produce.  This kind of episode is what most worries those who work in this business.  Thanks to God, there was not a sad ending and Marcos was able to return home.  At that point he decided to buy a truck which he could use to transport the fishermen to the docks, towing their boats so that they can go fishing.  His work starts at 7 o'clock in the morning and he works until 6 o'clock in the evening, from Monday to Saturday.  Marcos will use his loan to buy four new tires for his truck as his current ones are worn and he doesn't want to have any accidents.  Over time, he hopes to improve the service that he provides by replacing his truck or making some repairs to it.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Shehe

texts.en:
Shehe started operating his kiosk business five years ago. He used to work as a farmer but he decided to quit to start this business to earn a better income.  He has four children who are attending school. His wife is also a businesswoman and they both contribute to meeting the family needs.They work together to find ways to get ahead and to progress. He is requesting a loan to add stock of wheat flour, sugar, and other fast-selling products. 
His life project is to expand his business and open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, sugar, and other fast-selling products.

loans.name: Cecibel Magnolia

texts.es:
Cecibel tiene 40 años y es una mujer muy entusiasta y alegre, es madre de 2 hijos los cuales tienen 17y 9 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono hace ya varios años y desde ese momento se convirtió en padre y madre ´para ellos. La vivienda de Cecibel se encuentra en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por ser la cual de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y por tener la mayor población de origen afroperuano de nuestro país, esta ciudad también es muy conocida por el don que tienen sus pobladores para la ´preparación de platillos riquísimos y también por su alegría y generosidad. Cuando Cecibel tiene un tempito libre le gusta mucho pasear con sus hijos ya que siempre conversan y comparten gratos momentos, asimismo le gusta< preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios económicos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser enfermera.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Cecibel trabaja como empleada del hogar por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de disfraces, ella  es muy trabajadora y por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, porque lo hace con mucho gusto y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Cecibel está muy agradecida con los ´prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas disfraces para alquilar, con esta mejora podra tener más variedad de disfraces y poder mejorar sus ingresos, con ello mejorara sui calidad de vida y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir  su casa de material noble y poder darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Cecibel, 40, is a very enthusiastic, cheerful woman.  She’s the mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years of age who she loves very much and works hard for in order to support them alone since her children’s father abandoned them several years ago and she became both father and mother to her children from that moment on.

Cecibel’s house is located in the city of Chincha which is noted for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes and for having the country’s largest Afro-Peruvian population.  This city is also very well-known for the residents’ special gift for cooking delicious food and also for their cheerfulness and generosity.

When Cecibel has any free time available she likes to go on walks with her children because they can chat and share pleasant moments together.  She also likes preparing one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Carpulcra con Sopa Seca.”  Because of her family’s limited economic resources she only attended elementary school but would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Cecibel works as a domestic employee in the morning and in the afternoon works in her small business renting costumes.  She is very hardworking and this is why she thinks she does well in her business, because she does it happily and above all with a strong drive to get ahead.

Cecibel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more costumes to rent and with this improvement will have a wider variety of costumes to improve her income.  With that she will improve her quality of life and continue working to make her greatest dream a reality: To build a house with substantial materials and to be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy costumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Nkubu and has been in farming for ten years. She is married with five adult children, but she lives with her youngest, aged 20 years and still taking his post-secondary education. Joyce runs her farm with the help of two farmhands.  She produces milk, fruits, maize, and vegetables for the local market.

Joyce has requested a loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry.  She says the additional income from raising poultry will enable her to finish educating her youngest child and improve her family's living standard. She also plans to start a retail shop business. 

This loan request is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.  She reiterates that her farming income has really improved and has better prospects for the future.

Joyce says she appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's efficient services.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise on her farm.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, a married mother of six children, all in school, also takes care of one orphan. She resides in a two-room rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

The operator of a beauty salon for 10 years, Aisha works seven days a week and earns additional income through tailoring. She is requesting a loan of 1000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and a hair dryer. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing cosmetics prices in Uganda.

Aisha aspires to see her business grow so that she owns a fully-stocked beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a twenty-five-old single gentleman. He lives in Mwambalazi, Southern Coast of Kenya. He has been running a charcoal selling business for the last two years. He supplements his income by selling coconuts.  His biggest challenge is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to save money and go to college and his business goal is to expand his business into new markets. Shee would like a loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.
He narrates that his major challenge is high transport cost. Shee lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim lives in small town in Kosovo. He is married and he has two children. He is a hardworking person, serious and responsible. Bekim offers his services as a taxi driver. He began to work a half day, and now works full time. The city in which he lives is the only city in Kosovo where taxi driver has permission to carry passengers to and from the airport. This business is the only income for his family.

He requests a loan from KosInvest for the first time to register his taxi and to pay for his work permit. This loan will help him to continue his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To register his taxi and to pay for his work permit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair drier and cosmetics, such as braids etc.

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es: Verónica vive en la Libertad dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, empezó vendiendo productos pero poco a poco ha ido cambiando hasta incorporar en sus ventas lo que es ropa. Las marcas que vende son muy reconocidas en el mercado lo cual le facilita la promoción y al incorporar las ventas obtuvo el resultado esperado porque ya contaba con clientes. El trabajo lo realiza con su esposo quien al no encontrar un negocio estable empezó ayudándole hasta darse cuenta que tenia mejores ganancias, ahora en la acompaña en sus recorridos ya que tiene un auto y le ayuda con la cobranza. Se dedican las mañanas al negocio ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en clases. Con el préstamo Verónica comprara ropa para niños y mayores, esperando con un poco de esfuerzo abrir un negocio estable.
texts.en: Verónica lives in La Libertad and works selling beauty products via catalogue.  She started selling products but has gradually been changing and incorporating clothing sales.  The brands she sells are very well-known in the marketplace which makes promoting them easier and when she started to sell them she got the expected results because she already had an established clientele.  She runs the business with her husband who unable to find a stable business started helping her and realized profits were better.  Now, he accompanies her on her routes since he has a car and also helps her with payment collection.  They spend mornings in the business which is when their children are in school.  Verónica will use the loan to buy clothes for children and adults hoping with a little more effort to open a stable business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flora Virginia

texts.es:
La socia Flora Virginia nació en el departamento de Arequipa y desde hace 30 años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco,  es casada y fruto de unión tiene tres hijos. La socia Flora Virginia es profesora y ya son 20 años que enseña y le va muy bien. La socia Flora Virginia también se dedica a la venta de materiales educativos como guías educativas, fichas educativas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad la socia Flora Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como papeles, plumones, lapiceros, colores y otras cosas más. 

La socia Flora Virginia pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien pues una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en: Flora Virginia was born in Arequipa Department and has been living in the city of Cusco for the last 30 years.  She’s married and has three children.  Flora Virginia is a teacher and has been teaching for the last 20 years; she does very well.  She also sells teaching supplies like teacher’s guides, educational posters and other things.  On this occasion, Flora Virginia needs the loan to buy teaching supplies like paper, markers, pencils, colored pencils and other things.  Flora Virginia belongs to the “Luz del Sur” (Southern Light) communal bank and does well because she’s a responsible, punctual person.

loans.use: to buy teaching supplies.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS DIVINAS, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Adela vive por la localidad de la Guardia, ella tiene 25 años y dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 3 años, La Sra. Adela  se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Adela  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Adela va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Adela  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) communal bank has 8 members, all women.  The bank president is Adela who lives in La Guardia.  She’s 25-years-old and has two children whose ages are 5 and 3.  

Adela sells food in a stand located in the same zone where she lives.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and she will use it to buy sets of tables and chairs for her business to provide better comfort for her customers.  The reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business.  Adela will use profits to continue buying ingredients and thus improving her income.  

Her wish for her business is to have a restaurant and thus provide better customer service.  Adela is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity she and her fellow members are getting since in some cases they are the sole source of support for their families.

loans.use: to buy sets of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Guillermina ,la socia tiene 55 años de edad, casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de tortas y bocaditos para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como bautizos,matrimonios,fiestas de cumpleaños entre otros, la socia a la vez se dedica a la elaboración de bordados y tejidos, la socia vende estas manualidades a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y familiares, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tortas como harina, mantequilla, huevos entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción, brindando el servicio de taxi, venta de productos de belleza, restaurante, ferretería, venta de libros, docente, turismo.

La persona que sale en la foto adjunta es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Juntas y Unidas' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

The member is 55-year-old Guillermina who is married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making cakes and snacks for different events such as christenings, weddings, birthday parties, etc.  In addition, she also embroiders and weaves.  She sells her handicrafts to customers who request them such as friends and family members.  She is a responsible and determined person who has a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.

Guillermina is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making cakes such as flour, butter, eggs, etc.

The other members of this group work in different businesses.  They sell building supplies, provide a taxi service, sell beauty products, run a restaurant, sell hardware, sell books, work as a teacher and work in tourism.

The person in the attached photo is a member who requested permission to arrive late to the meeting.

Guillermina feels grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cakes such as flour, butter, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена продает школьные принадлежности и просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку товара к школьному сезону. Она имеет несколько своих киосков и надеется, что с помощью КИВА кредита, она сможет существенно увеличить торговый оборот. 

Елена трудолюбивая и отвественная. Елена хочет развивать бизнес, что бы улучшить быт семьи.
texts.en: Elena sells school supplies. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to stock up before the next school year. She has several vending stands and hopes to be able to increase her sales volume significantly thanks to Kiva’s financing. Elena is hard-working and responsible. She wants to develop her business further so as to improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies before the new school year.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his mid-30s, is married with one child, who goes to school. He has owned a grocery for eight years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to add to his grocery inventory, to buy a motorcycle, and to pay household expenses.  He has repaid all four loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy numerous items to restock his grocery store.  His dream is one day to be able to build his own house.

Godfrey will share this loan with his loan group, "Wazo Tegeta."   It has 17 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy various items to restock his grocery  store.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro, 40, is married to Mwanasiti and they are blessed with two school-aged children. He has been operating his own motorcycle for three years, offering all types of personal trips to anywhere his customers request. He is a very hardworking man who always looks for business opportunities. Nassoro also farms to earn more income. 

The loan he is requesting from Yehu is to buy seeds and also to hire cultivation labor.  His customers describe him as a kind and jovial man. Nassoro dreams of purchasing a pair of oxen in the future and also of opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and also to hire cultivation labor.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Walaa is a carpenter and has owned his carpentry business since 2000. He makes doors, bedroom closets and others.  He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to buy a generator and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and increase inventory
